title: Sparbanken Syd söker en AI-driven kommunikatör/copywriter
description:
**Vill du arbeta med kommunikation på enda självständiga sparbanken med en stark lokal närvaro? Vi söker en AI-driven kommunikatör/copywriter?**

**Om tjänsten**


Som AI-driven kommunikatör/Copywriter hos oss skapar du engagerande och värdeskapande innehåll för bankens interna och externa kanaler – från sociala medier och webb till intranät. Du översätter komplex finansiell information till tydlig och tillgänglig kommunikation som stärker vårt varumärke och erbjudande samt säkerställer att all kommunikation är i linje med bankens tonalitet. Du har ett nära samarbete med kollegor i banken för att skapa relevant kommunikation. Du använder AI-verktyg för research, textproduktion och för att utforska nya möjligheter inom automatiserad och personlig kommunikation. Du rapporterar till Johanna Stridh och tillhör Hållbarhet, Affärsutveckling och Kommunikation som är ett team på 9 personer. Din placeringsort är Ystad och du förväntas vara på plats ett par dagar varje vecka. Övriga dagar finns det möjlighet att arbeta på något av våra kontor alternativt hemifrån. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med tillträde enigt överenskommelse.

**Vem är du?**


För att trivas i rollen och hos oss är det avgörande att du gillar att arbeta brett med ett stort eget ansvar. Du är driven och tar egna initiativ, och väntar inte på att få arbetsuppgifter. Det är ett högt tempo hos oss vilket ställer höga krav på snabb och högkvalitativ leverans. Vi tror att du är en kommunikativ och strategisk copywriter som vill vara med och forma framtidens bankkommunikation. I din kommunikation går förtroende, tydlighet och innovation hand i hand. Du har en skarp språkkänsla som du kombinerar med nyfikenhet på teknik och vet hur man använder AI som ett verktyg för att skapa relevant, mänsklig och träffsäker kommunikation. Du förstår vikten av att tala med kunder, inte till kunder.


Vi söker dig som:

* Har relevant utbildning inom kommunikation, journalistik, marknadsföring eller liknande.
* Har arbetslivserfarenhet av copywriting eller innehållsproduktion i komplexa miljöer, gärna inom finans, försäkring eller annan reglerad sektor.
* Mycket god språkkänsla på svenska
* Erfarenhet av att använda AI-verktyg som stöd i idéarbete, textproduktion eller analys.


Vidare har du en förmåga att kombinera kreativitet med struktur, precision och ansvarstagande. Du har också ett stort intresse för teknik, digitalisering och hur AI förändrar kundkommunikationen.


Det är meriterande om du har:

* Erfarenhet av sitecore-plattformen
* Grundläggande förståelse för SEO, UX-writing eller markering automation


Hos oss på Sparbanken Syd tror vi att människor utvecklas när de får vara sig själva, känna sig trygga och får vara med och påverka. Som medarbetare blir du en viktig del av en självständig sparbank med stark lokal förankring och ett tydligare syfte: Att bidra till en hållbar ekonomisk utveckling, både för våra kunder och för samhället i stort.

**Vad erbjuder vi?**


Vi erbjuder mer än bara ett jobb – vi erbjuder en plats där du kan växa.  

Du får bland annat;

* En trygg arbetsplats där du kan vara dig själv.
* En bank med korta beslutsvägar, stark värdegrund och en vilja att testa nytt.,
* Förmåner, som t ex; rabatt på bolån, privatvårdsförsäkring, hälsoundersökning, friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr/år, Benify (förmånsportal), ersättning vid föräldraledighet.

**Så här ansöker du**  

Du behöver inte skriva något personligt brev – vi fokuserar på din kompetens och erfarenhet. I stället ber vi dig svara på ett antal frågor, vänligen referera inte till ditt CV. För att säkerställa en rättvis process arbetar vi kompetensbaserat och därför kommer din ansökan att vara anonymiserad alt därför kommer vi att anonymisera din ansökan


Hos oss ska alla känna sig välkomna. Vi vet att olika bakgrunder och perspektiv gör oss starka och därför arbetar vi aktivt med mångfald, inkluderingoch psykologisk trygghet - i vardagen och i rekryteringen.

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag som är den 2025-12-07.*


Har du frågor är du välkommen att ringa Johanna Stridh, 0411-82 21 81, eller HR Katariina Eskola, 0411-82 22 07. Kontaktperson för Finansförbundet är Richelle Cruz 0411–82 21 52.

 **Välkommen med din ansökan!**


Hos oss är det viktigt att arbeta nära och transparent – därför hanterar vi hela rekryteringsprocessen själva och undanber oss kontakt från externa rekryteringsföretag.

  

Välkommen till livet på den gula sidan! Till en bank som ingen annan. Sveriges enda självständiga sparbank, som jobbar hållbart, svarar när du ringer och pratar så du förstår. Banken, på ren skånska. Med genuin lokal förankring vill vi stärka dig genom bättre ekonomihälsa. Vi stärker lokalsamhället genom att ge tillbaka. Vi är en trygg följeslagare i livet och karriären, genom generationer. Vi har funnits sedan 1827 och har alltid haft ett starkt samhällsengagemang – det ligger i vårt DNA. Vi tror på människan, på långsiktighet och på att bank ska vara enkelt och mänskligt. Vår vinst går inte till aktieägare utan till vår stiftelse, som återinvesterar i samhället. Det är vår idé om hållbar ekonomi.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Ystad | Län: | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/29 | Publicerat: 2025-11-19 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-07

title: Fullstack Engineer (Team Scale: Ecosystem)
description:
**Tl;dr:** We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who loves building ecosystems and marketplaces. One month you’ll ship features that help creators share templates, components, and services. The next, you’ll launch discovery, reputation, and education initiatives that help builders learn faster and find opportunities. You think in code, but your instinct is always: will this make the ecosystem stronger and our builders more successful?

**Coding skills + excellent taste + growth instincts + product obsession = you.**

**Why Lovable?**
----------------


Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.


We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.

**What we’re looking for**
--------------------------

* 5+ years building and growing user-facing products, ideally including marketplaces, platforms, or communities.
* Strong product sense and UX taste for multi-sided ecosystems with creators, learners, and customers.
* Comfortable using data, funnels, and experiments to shape what you build and how you iterate.
* Experience collaborating across functions (design, marketing, partnerships, support) to launch and grow new surfaces.
* Motivated by helping others succeed and by seeing impact through engagement, usage, and revenue.

**What you’ll do**
------------------


In one sentence: You will build the marketplace and ecosystem surfaces that help Lovable builders share their work, learn faster, and find opportunities.

* Ship marketplace features for publishing, discovering, and reusing apps, templates, components, and services.
* Build connection surfaces such as profiles, reviews, and matching flows between builders and customers.
* Launch learning and community initiatives that help builders grow and succeed with Lovable.
* Shape monetization and revenue-share models that work for creators, customers, and Lovable.
* Keep the experience relentlessly Lovable while making growth the engine, not the afterthought.

**Our tech stack**
------------------


We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:

* Frontend: React
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, infra-as-code (Terraform)


And always on the lookout for what's next!

**How applying works**

* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* Join us for a round of technical interviews
* Team intro calls with the team

**About your application**
--------------------------


Please submit your application in English — it’s our company language.  

We treat all candidates equally, so please apply through our careers portal.


Apply by clicking the link below.

title: Content Creator (9319)
description:
**Content Creator, Delaval**
============================


Do you want to work in an innovative company where you can contribute to a more sustainable world? DeLaval is the world's largest Creator, manufacturer and supplier of milk production solutions. We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare.  


#### **Role and responsibilities**



We are now looking for a Content Creator to join the Product Management & Development team. The responsibilities of the Content Creator include creating original content for e-learning courses, which include copywriting, graphics, and technical work. To be successful as a Content Creator, you are a great communicator and listener, well-structured and organised, creative and imaginative, a contributing team member, able to write and edit online content for e-learning courses, marketing, and front-end web development. Ultimately, a top-notch Content Creator has a strong working knowledge of content development and management software, a basic understanding of HTML, and an eye for detail.  


* Plan, develop and deliver rich and engaging e-learning content
* Create and innovate interactive and visual content (text, audio, and video) for e-learning courses
* Work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment with subject matter experts, product managers, UX designers, technical writers and learning and development experts
* Evaluate, maintain and update engaging e-learning experiences and course content
* Translate the users' needs into engaging and creative learning solutions

  


#### **Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree with a focus on Communication, Media, Marketing, Computer Science or a related field.
* Proven experience in developing e-learning content by using Articulate 360, 2-year
* Proven experience in using a camera for green screen recordings and Adobe Premiere Pro for video editing
* Graphical skills
* Experience with packaging courses to our LMS (Familiarity with configuring, importing, and exporting SCORM and Tin Can xAPI packages)
* Knowledge in developing content in an Agile way
* Proven ability to manage multiple eLearning content development projects at the same time
* Experience with SuccessFactors or any other LMS
* Background in Engineering is preferable but not essential
* Fluent in English

  


**Considered as merits;**
* Experience of utilizing 3D design and modeling tools
* Knowledge and working experience JavaScript, CSS, HTML experience

  



You will be a part of the DeLaval Product Management & Development Team (PMD) and report directly to the VP Milk Quality Solutions located in the UK. The position is as a consultant for a period of one year to start and located at the DeLaval HQ in Tumba, Stockholm.  


#### **Working at DeLaval**



Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.  


We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel. In addition, we offer:

* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness allowance of SEK 4 000/year.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.

  


#### **Additional** **information**



This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.

We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.  



#### **Contact**



Hiring manager: Tony Drake, tony.drake@delaval.com

Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com  


#### **About DeLaval**



Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.

Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.  

See more at corporate.delaval.com
company_addresses: Gustaf De Lavals väg 15, 147 21 Tumba, Sweden

title: Digital Product Owner
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As a **Digital Product Owner (DPO)**, you will work closely with Digital Product Managers, SMEs, UX Designers, Data Analysts, suppliers and stakeholders, to continuously improve our products and the user experience. We are an environment where ideas, thoughts and opinions can be shared. We have clear common ambitions, and we create the future together.


Within this role, constructive collaboration with the other entities of Volvo Group, external partners, and HCL organization is a key factor of success. You will need to develop good relationship with your business partners and stakeholders.


Scope: Volvo Group Level and IT partners.

**Who are you?**
----------------

* + We believe you want to take your career to the next level, working with amazing people around the world. To be successful in this position we believe you have a university degree or equivalent, and experience of leading functionally, preferably within IT management.
	+ You have proven experience as a leader, good understanding of our partners and suppliers and have a clear Quality & Compliance focus.
	+ You have personal drive-in functional management and strong networking; you can set direction and measurement and understand how these contribute to the Volvo Group vision and strategy.
	+ You share core values according to the Volvo Way.
	+ You could manage diversity, work in cross functional teams and build trust in the organization.
	+ You actively collaborate with various stakeholders and navigate with ease in a multi-cultural environment.
	+ You are comfortable with driving change and have courage to make decisions.
	+ You also need to have a structured approach towards tackling challenges and handling various issues.
	+ You get an opportunity to work together with highly skilled colleagues in an exciting, global environment which provides opportunities to develop both professionally and personally.
	+ Furthermore, we believe this role requires experience from working towards digital product orientation, onsite delivery framework, stable team framework and agile ways of working.
	+ In addition to this, you are a passionate believer in lifelong learning. You should feel energized by working both independently and interdependently, have proven skills in cross-functional collaboration and thrive in managing, fostering, and enable both the performance and the transformation angles of the job.
**This is how you could make an impact**
----------------------------------------


As the Digital Product Owner, you will take ownership of specific part of the digital product and as a champion of the product vision and your team, you will turn the roadmap into deliverables and secure the alignment with the overall strategy and product vision. You are a member of a stable team and are responsible for managing the team backlog prioritization and delivery.


You will lead the OBO (On Behalf of) and ODF (Onsite Delivery Framework) Stable Team responsible for tactical and Strategic Area, and report to the IT Operations Management Manager.

**These will be some selected responsibilities**
------------------------------------------------

* Support the team in creating product specifications in the form of user stories with acceptance criteria, to ensure the stable team have all required information to deliver the desired outcome.
* Lead the digital solution discovery process for assigned capabilities (including hypothesis generation, requirements gathering, design, and scoping) in collaboration with the digital product manager, suppliers, UX designers, data analysts, and Subject matter experts.
* You manage the Strategic and Tactical initiatives backlog and order and ensure that the backlog is visible, transparent, and understood.
* Contribute to the digital solution vision and champion this vision with stakeholders, suppliers and the stable team.
* Ensure that proper analytics, tracking and data collection mechanisms are in place to understand user behaviors and/or performance.
* Provide the necessary support to the stable team as may be required to aid their delivery.
* Work with suppliers as needed to ensure expected outcomes are achieved and measured.
* Manage the monthly board meetings, scope changes of sites and resource utilization.
* Owns team development to secure the team long and short-term plans for proper capacity and competence.
* Learning customer needs through data and customer feedback.
* Define the OLA with suppliers (Accountable).
* Address supplier challenges related to FTE usage.
* Collaborate with each supplier on settlement processes at the end of the year.
* Develop a comprehensive strategic plan for OBO and ODF.
* Govern and maintain the quality of Volvo Site Description.
* Secure Strategic relationship between Volvo management and HCL.

  

Since you are part of a global unit, with global responsibilities, you will need to actively cooperate with various stakeholders and navigate with ease in a multi-cultural environment. It is important you have an innovative and creative mind-set to inspire and challenge yourself in your organization. You also have a strong quality focus and a personal drive to reach the objectives and targets set for your unit, understanding how these contribute to the Volvo Group vision and strategy.

  

“In some countries and for specific positions within Volvo Group Digital & IT, background checks may be required, in accordance with local laws & regulations. If this is applicable to the role you have applied for, you will be informed.”

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Business Analyst within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*

  

**The position**  

As a Business Analyst, you will be a part of one or several agile development teams including developers and testers. You will also collaborate closely with product owner(s), other business analysts, informaticians, architects and UX designers. You will investigate and analyze needs, detail requirements, and design solutions for one of Sweden’s leading healthcare journal systems. You are an important link between the developers and the customer, with the mission to understand the needs of our end users and translate them into technical solutions. You often get to follow an initiative all the way from pre-study to development and implementation at the customer's premises. As part of our team, you will do meaningful work where you help to improve and digitize healthcare processes.


We are currently looking for Business Analysts who will be working with one of our areas such as e.g. Order Management, Care plans and Regulatory requirements. You will be working with creating both functional and non-functional requirements.


At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.  

  

  

  

**About you**  

You work independently and with your own drive, but also thrive when you get the opportunity to collaborate with your teammates, other Business Analysts, as well as other roles across the organization. You like to meet our customers, partners and eHealth organizations and are passionate about finding the best solutions. We believe that you are analytical, well-structured and with strong cooperation skills.


**Requirements**


* Minimum 3 years of working with business analysis, requirement analysis, product design or similar.
* Great knowledge in how business needs can be translated into software requirements.
* Great ability to collaborate with product owner(s), architects, system developers and UX designers.
* Communicates fluently in English and Swedish.

**It's a bonus if you have**

* Experience of health informatics, and/or integration work (e.g. API design).
* Knowledge of healthcare standards and specifications (FHIR, HL7v2, RIVTA, OpenEHR, SNOMED CT)
* Previously worked within healthcare
* Experience of COSMIC and related integration solutions
* Experience in working with agile software development
* Experience in UX design

  

  

**Place of employment**: Linköping or Stockholm  

  



**Scope**: Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period  

  



We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.  

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**


Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life**.** Read more about us **here!**

 **A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible** **-**explore our employee benefits


Learn more about our recruitment process here.


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.

title: UX Designer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med UX/UI, med tyngdpunkt på UX och designprocessen.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta i Figma.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med användningstester, intervjuer och analys.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling.
* Svenska som arbetsspråk, både i tal och skrift.

  

**Meriterande**  

* Vara kommunikativ och ha hög samarbetsförmåga i arbetet med design och designbeslut.
* Förmåga att självständigt identifiera problem och föreslå kreativalösningar.
* Dokumenterad kompetens inom tillgänglighet (WCAG eller motsvarande).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med CMS
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom mediabranschen
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med komponentbibliotek (designsystem).

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 25-11-2025 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

We believe that you are fully fluid in both backend and frontend development with primarily focus on .Net/C# (Java is a bonus) and enjoy solving complex technical problems. You know how to build scalable and well performing solutions. You have experience working with databases such as Mongo, Cosmos and UX/UI and with CI/CD pipelines. You also know your way around Kubernetes, Typescript, Azure Cloud Services and Angular. You understand what it means to work with agile team principles.  

It is also beneficial if you have some experience with direct client management, network programming such as TCP/UDP and vehicle protocols CAN, CAN-FD, DoIP, UDS, Windows desktop application development in WinUI/WPF.  

Like taking requirements and have a solid passion for the user needs and user journey.  

  

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 25-11-2025

 **About Us**  

  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Product Design Lead
description:
At Anyfin, we believe finance should work in favor of the consumer – not the other way around. That’s why we build smart, transparent and customer-first solutions that make everyday finances easier and fairer.


But we aim higher: more customers, products, markets… all of which need a well-designed, flawless experience. That’s why we’re currently looking for a **Senior Product Design Lead** to join us and elevate our product experience across the board.

**What you will be doing**
--------------------------


As a Senior Product Design Lead at Anyfin, you will drive the vision, quality, and execution of the design experience across multiple product areas. You connect design quality to strategy and measurable business results.


You will lead the Product Design team while working hands-on the majority of your time. When we say lead, we mean *by example*: you maintain a high bar for visual and interaction design and bring clarity to complex problem spaces. You’re a true player/coach — someone who can zoom into the finer details of the craft while coaching others to raise our collective output.


Collaboration is central to the role. You don’t just work closely with Product, Engineering, and Marketing—you define and evolve the ways of working across discovery, delivery, and validation, ensuring what we ship is beautiful, intuitive, strategically aligned, and measurably impactful. You will guide teams through discovery, delivery, and validation and help break down complex financial concepts into clear, elegant, user-friendly experiences.


Your work will have a direct impact on how customers interact with their finances, and your contributions will play a big part in our mission of making financial well-being happen.

**Who you are**
---------------


We’re looking for someone who thrives at the intersection of leadership, craft, and strategic thinking — someone who elevates the team while pushing the quality of the product experience forward. Here’s what we’re looking for:

* You have deep experience leading product design in fast-paced environments and are comfortable guiding multiple product areas at once. Fintech or financial services experience is a bonus.
* You bring a deep understanding of UX design patterns and usability principles, and you set a consistently high visual and interaction bar.
* You excel at translating complex problems into simple, elegant, user-centric solutions.
* You have strong native mobile design expertise, from navigation patterns to platform conventions.
* You lead cross‑functional collaboration with Product, Engineering, and Marketing, aligning stakeholders and decisions across multiple product areas.
* You’re comfortable defining and running product discovery and validation activities and tying design decisions directly to business goals and measurable outcomes.
* You design within regulatory and compliance constraints (e.g., KYC/AML, disclosures) without sacrificing clarity or user experience.
* You’re comfortable defining and running product discovery and validation activities, and you consistently link design decisions to business goals and measurable outcomes.
* You have experience designing within regulatory or compliance constraints without sacrificing user experience.
* You have experience owning or scaling design systems — ensuring accessibility, consistency, and efficiency across teams.

**What we offer**
-----------------


We offer you the chance to be part of something truly meaningful. You’ll work alongside colleagues in Product, Engineering, Marketing, Credit, Operations and more — giving you a broad playground to influence and shape. We promise you’ll be challenged, supported, and given work that truly matters.


Beyond the mission, we offer a competitive compensation package, a centrally located and cozy office, extra time off on your birthday, and plenty of other benefits along the way.


If you’re ready to help build the future of user-centric financial products, click “Apply” below.
  

  

We can’t wait to meet you!
company_description: We're the rebels of the financial industry, putting an end to overpriced financial products. We push the envelope of fintech and financial health!

title: Product Designer
description:
Anyfin is on a mission to change millions of financial lives for the better. Since our start over seven years ago, we’ve been doing this one customer at a time — with user experience and design at the core of our offering. But we aim higher; new customers, new products, and new design challenges. That’s why we are currently looking for a **Product Designer** to join our Design team.

**What you will be doing**
--------------------------


Your focus will be on creating intuitive, user-centric solutions that truly help people understand and manage their finances — every single day. This means collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Customer Service teams across all our markets to ensure we’re building thoughtful, effective, and accessible product experiences.


A big part of your work will involve driving design efforts from exploration to launch and beyond. You’ll rapidly prototype, iterate, and explore multiple directions to uncover the best possible solutions. You will also contribute to and evolve our shared Design System, ensuring visual consistency and design quality across the entire product ecosystem.


We adopt a hypothesis-driven approach, grounding our work in user feedback, data, and structured thinking. At Anyfin, the products you design genuinely matter — helping people take control of their personal finances.

**Who you are**
---------------


We’re looking for someone with a strong passion for visual excellence, systems thinking, and user experience — someone who wants to stay hands-on with the craft while collaborating across teams. You inspire those around you and help raise the overall design quality across the organization. And yes, here come the bullet points (they do serve a purpose):

* A proven track record as a product designer in a fast-paced environment, ideally designing B2C products that make a real difference to users.
* Strong UI craft and a solid understanding of UX design patterns.
* A portfolio that demonstrates clear, structured thinking and a user-centered design approach.
* Experience driving design work end-to-end: exploration, prototyping, iteration, delivery, and continuous improvement.
* The ability to quickly explore multiple design directions and use feedback to guide decision-making.
* Strong communication skills — you present your ideas clearly, manage stakeholders effectively, and tie design decisions to measurable outcomes and business goals.
* Experience collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams.
* Openness to feedback and a desire to grow both personally and in how design impacts teams and the broader organization.
* Bonus points if you’ve contributed to or scaled design systems across teams.

**What we offer**
-----------------


We offer you the chance to be part of something truly meaningful. You’ll work alongside colleagues who are ridiculously passionate about users and the experience we deliver to them. We promise you’ll be challenged, supported, and given the opportunity to work on things that actually matter.


Then there’s the competitive compensation package, our centrally located and cozy office, extra time off on your birthday, and a bunch of other benefits. But we’ll get to all that in due time. For now, begin your journey with us by clicking **"Apply"** below.


We cannot wait to meet you!

title: UX Designer (Robotics) - Mölndal, Gothenburg
description:
Do you want to shape the next generation of industrial and collaborative robotics? We are looking for an experienced UX Designer for a consulting assignment within hyper-realistic simulation . You will join a global R&D environment working with advanced tools for robot programming, modeling, and simulation.

### **About the Assignment**


You will work with the development of a leading product suite for robot programming, modeling, and simulation. Together with designers and developers, you will tackle complex design challenges and create solutions that truly make an impact .

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Play a key role in the design process from early concepts to final solutions
* Create user journeys, personas, wireframes, and interactive prototypes
* Visualize complex ideas and translate them into clear designs ready for development
* Document design proposals following established principles
* Work in a modern, agile software environment using up-to-date tools
* Follow and contribute to improving the company’s UX framework and processes
* Seek and analyze user feedback to continuously refine the product

**Your profile**
----------------

* Fluent in English; motivated to learn Swedish
* Master’s degree in design, human–computer interaction (HCI), or another relevant field
* 3+ years of professional experience as a UX designer
* Strong proficiency in Figma
* A strong portfolio showcasing projects across platforms and devices
* Hands-on experience throughout all stages of the design process
* Experience with design systems (plus)
* Skills in icon design and vector graphics (plus)
* Familiarity with UX writing and content creation (plus)

### **Workplace and Scope**

**Location:** Mölndal, Gothenburg (SE)  

**Remote work:** Approx. 25%  

**Start:** 16 Jan 2026  

**End:** 30 Jun 2026  

**On-site presence:** At least 4 days per week


Please submit your application as soon as possible!

  

Sway Sourcing is an innovative recruitment partner specializing in matching the right talent with the right company—quickly and efficiently. Our primary focus lies in Finance, Administration, HR, Marketing, and IT, but we also have the broad expertise and flexibility required to deliver tailored recruitment solutions across all industries.


Although we are a relatively new player, we have already gained the trust of many of Sweden's largest companies and operate both nationally and internationally. With bases in Sweden and Spain, we offer a unique combination of local expertise and global reach. Our strong network and deep industry insights make us the obvious partner for companies looking to stay ahead in their recruitment efforts.

title: Product Designer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**We at the User Growth Team,** 
 focus on product led growth in order to accelerate the growth of our user base, improve user onboarding experience and increase retention.
   

  

**As a Product Designer,** 
 you’ll craft intuitive, user-friendly designs that millions of Truecaller users will rely on and love, enhancing their trust in all aspects of mobile communication. Join us and share your creativity with users across the globe.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* You’ll be involved in diagnosing and understanding the pain points in the user journey of various segments of Truecaller users.
* You will conduct user research interviews and usability tests to deeply understand user behavior, validate design hypotheses, and ensure solutions are user-centric and effective.
* You will generate ideas with your team to innovate on existing product features to improve the retention and win-back of users.
* You will generate designs primarily on the Android platform.
* You will work on prototypes, wireframes and collaborate with the product team on the design solutions. You will also have a chance to learn from other product designers across the organization.
* You will be nimble and work in an Agile team A/B testing to optimize learning and be willing to iterate your solutions and designs.
* You will deliver high quality design assets on time.
* You will have opportunities to collaborate with other BU teams within the organization to improve the overall user experience.


**What You Bring In**
* 4+ years of experience in designing for a mobile platform (preferably Android)
* Curiosity is the key for this role. We are looking for someone with an impressive portfolio of mobile UI/UX and a proven ability to learn new things.
* Good understanding of Android Concepts and user behavioral patterns.
* Proficiency in Figma/Sketch/XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and other equivalent interface design and wire-framing tools.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Deep understanding of the role of typography, information hierarchy on mobile devices.
* Awareness of the distinct design patterns and user preferences in markets like India. ‘How many people know swipe, long press’ - if this question crosses your mind while designing, you are already there!
* Truecaller user (hopefully) and deep appreciation for the problem Truecaller solves for its hundreds of millions of users.


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Design**
 Team
   

  

**User Growth**
 Posted
   

  

**14 days ago**

* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med UX-design för webbapplikationer.
* Dinst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utveckla i Angular och/eller React.
* Minst 2 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med Designsystem.

title: Product Analysis Internship
description:
With millions of weekly visits, millions of active users and items changing owners every three seconds, Tradera is one of the largest circular marketplaces in Scandinavia. Our platform processes vast amounts of data around the clock and plays a key role in shifting consumption toward more sustainable choices. Data-driven analysis is at the heart of that mission.
   

  

 We are now opening applications for our 9-month Product Analysis Internship.
   

  

 You will be a part of the analytics team reporting to the Head of Analytics.
   

  

**Areas of responsibility**
* Identify opportunities to improve user experience and conversion rates
* Use Google Analytics for product and user behaviour analytics and data collection setup and monitoring
* Answer questions from the organization regarding user behavior and the user journey
* Collaborate cross-functionally within the organization


**Who We Are Looking For**
* Bachelor's degree or previous experience within a relevant field
* Curious, analytical and motivated to learn fast
* Enjoys teamwork, sharing knowledge and taking initiative
* Strong analytical skills preferably in Google Analytics and Tableau
* Easy to communicate and present insights in Swedish and English


**It is a plus if you have**
* Experience with Google Tag Manager
* Experience with SQL or BigQuery
* Experience with Tableau
* Experience in setting up pipelines


**About Tradera**
 Our goal is to drive the transition to sustainable shopping. It's what motivates us every day and guides the decisions we make. We use our platform, our reach and our collective effort to push that shift forward. With more than five million weekly visits we know the impact is real and growing. Data and analysis are key parts of that work which is why we're looking for someone who wants to be part of that journey and help us get even better.
   

  

**Location** 
 : Hybrid, Stockholm
   

  

**Language** 
 : Fluent in Swedish and English
   

  

**Start** 
**Date** 
 : January 2026
   

  

**Employment** 
**type** 
 : Full time

CTO & Co-Founder – Join an Early-Stage PropTech Startup with Global Scalability
description:
Join the next Airbnb for office spaces. Commercial real estate is one of the world’s largest yet least digitized industries, full of inefficiencies in how space is leased, managed, and valued. The shift toward flexible work and data-driven decisions has opened a once-in-a-generation opportunity to rebuild the digital infrastructure of this $20+ trillion market.
 



 Just as Airbnb transformed hospitality, Qasa modernized residential rentals, and xNomad reinvented retail, Shace is redefining how companies find and use office space. While Airbnb transformed short-term rentals, Shace is tackling long-term commercial leasing - a vast, overlooked market with enormous potential.
 



  





 At Shace, we’re reimagining one of the world’s most established industries. Join us and help build the platform that will reshape the future of work.
 



  





**Accomplishments** 




**In just the past year, we’ve turned concept into traction:** 



* **MVP ready for pilot testing** 
 , the first platform combining marketplace and operations
* **Strong user waitlist** 
 already in place and test group actively providing feedback
* **Selected for the KTH Innovation Launch Program**
* **Pilot customers secured** 
 , with larger companies ready to post listings after launch
* **Early investor interest** 
 , with several reviewing our demo
* **Confirmed market need** 
 , validated by strong industry feedback



 We’ve built fast, validated continuously, and attracted real industry interest.
 



  





**The Journey Ahead** 




 We’re entering an exciting phase at Shace moving from development to real-world validation and growth. The coming months will focus on pilot testing with selected partners, preparing for launch, and laying the foundations for a scalable organization. As we grow, we’re also building a strong, product-driven culture centered on innovation, collaboration, and impact.
 



 At Shace, we want you to have fun while building. Try things, test bold ideas, and follow your curiosity - we’ll refine and build on them together. It’s a truly collaborative environment where every voice matters, every idea counts, and everyone shares ownership of the product and the journey
 



  





**The Role** 




 We’re looking for a
 **CTO & Co-Founder** 
 to lead our technology vision and execution. You will play a key role in shaping the product architecture, driving technical excellence, and ensuring a successful platform launch.
 



  





**What You’ll Accomplish** 



* Lead the technical development from pilot to full-scale launch.
* Build and guide the tech team, establishing a strong engineering culture.
* Drive innovation and scalability across the platform.
* Play a core role in shaping the future of commercial real estate technology.



  





**Why Join Shace?** 




 Joining Shace means stepping in at the ground floor of a company that’s redefining one of the world’s largest industries. As
 **Co-Founder & CTO** 
 , you’ll have real ownership - both in equity and in shaping the product, the culture, and the future direction of the company.
 



 As an early-stage co-founder, you’ll join ahead of external funding - at a stage where investor conversations are active and momentum is building. You’ll have meaningful ownership and real influence, with compensation growing as we secure funding and scale.
 



 You’ll be building scalable, high-impact technology that transforms how businesses find and lease commercial spaces - an opportunity to design the architecture of an entire industry shift.
 



 We’re offering:
 


* **Co-founder role** 
 with the potential for equity and payment, discussed and agreed upon together
* The chance to
 **build and lead** 
 the tech team from the ground up
* The ability to
 **shape product and technical vision** 
 with full creative freedom
* A direct role in achieving
 **a successful pilot and market launch**
* Competitive compensation upon funding and growth milestones
* Mentorship from coaches at KTH Innovation and access to an ambitious network of startups
* You’ll be working closely with a small, driven founding team where ideas move fast and every contribution counts



  





 This is an opportunity to build not just a product, but a company and a future, together.
 



 Skills & Requirements
 



  





**Background, Skills & Experience** 




 We’re looking for a
 **technical leader and builder** 
 : someone who thrives in early-stage environments, loves solving complex problems, and wants to shape a product and team from the ground up.
 



  





**Key skills:** 



* Experience or strong interest in modern web technologies (TypeScript, React, Node.js, Python, etc.)
* Understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure) and scalable backend design
* Curiosity for data-driven systems, automation, or AI-based matching
* Familiarity with DevOps, CI/CD, or building secure, maintainable systems
* A product-oriented mindset - you care about user experience, speed, and impact



**I** 




**deal background:** 



* You’ve built or contributed to digital platforms, SaaS products, or marketplaces - experience in B2B tech is a plus, but not required.
* You enjoy working across the stack and have experience with modern web development, architecture, or system design - or have built complex systems from idea to launch.
* You’re comfortable switching between hands-on coding and product thinking, collaborating closely with founders to shape features and impact.



  





*We welcome candidates from all backgrounds - what matters most is your passion for building, your long term curiosity for code, and your drive to create real impact. If you’re passionate about tech, curious, and eager to build, we’d love to hear from you, even if you don’t tick every box*

title: Content Creator
description:
**Content Creator, Delaval**
 Do you want to work in an innovative company where you can contribute to a more sustainable world? DeLaval is the world's largest Creator, manufacturer and supplier of milk production solutions. We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 We are now looking for a Content Creator to join the Product Management & Development team. The responsibilities of the Content Creator include creating original content for e-learning courses, which include copywriting, graphics, and technical work. To be successful as a Content Creator, you are a great communicator and listener, well-structured and organised, creative and imaginative, a contributing team member, able to write and edit online content for e-learning courses, marketing, and front-end web development. Ultimately, a top-notch Content Creator has a strong working knowledge of content development and management software, a basic understanding of HTML, and an eye for detail.
   

  

* Plan, develop and deliver rich and engaging e-learning content
* Create and innovate interactive and visual content (text, audio, and video) for e-learning courses
* Work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment with subject matter experts, product managers, UX designers, technical writers and learning and development experts
* Evaluate, maintain and update engaging e-learning experiences and course content
* Translate the users' needs into engaging and creative learning solutions


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree with a focus on Communication, Media, Marketing, Computer Science or a related field.
* Proven experience in developing e-learning content by using Articulate 360, 2-year
* Proven experience in using a camera for green screen recordings and Adobe Premiere Pro for video editing
* Graphical skills
* Experience with packaging courses to our LMS (Familiarity with configuring, importing, and exporting SCORM and Tin Can xAPI packages)
* Knowledge in developing content in an Agile way
* Proven ability to manage multiple eLearning content development projects at the same time
* Experience with SuccessFactors or any other LMS
* Background in Engineering is preferable but not essential
* Fluent in English


**Considered as merits;**
* Experience of utilizing 3D design and modeling tools
* Knowledge and working experience JavaScript, CSS, HTML experience


 You will be a part of the DeLaval Product Management & Development Team (PMD) and report directly to the VP Milk Quality Solutions located in the UK. The position is as a consultant for a period of one year to start and located at the DeLaval HQ in Tumba, Stockholm.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness allowance of SEK 4 000/year.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Tony Drake, tony.drake@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Product Designer (Bangkok - Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**The Domain of Enterprise Products**
 Behind the scenes of crafting compelling experiences for our millions of customers, we are diligently designing and optimizing hotel partner management products to cater to complex business scenarios on the B2B front. The enterprise products we develop at Agoda empower internal business users to control and update property information. Simultaneously, we enable over 600,000 properties worldwide to manage their content, pricing, allotments, customer segments, promotions, and market exposure effectively.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team:**
 The Design team is a diverse group of product designers and researchers that help to build Agoda’s products from our home office in Bangkok. Being a product-driven company, we constantly partner with product managers and engineers to understand user problems and design workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces. There is always an opportunity for growth here. Focus on your craft to improve or expand your skill set, or step into a managerial role and flex your talents as a designer and driver of team projects. The opportunity and timing are now if you wish to come into a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy. Be a part of Agoda’s Design team and unlock the world for our global community of hotels and travelers.
   

  

**Experience Requirements & Role Expectations:**
* 4+ years of full-time experience as a UX/Interaction designer for digital or web-based products; in-house designer experience highly preferred
* Has experience of managing multiple stakeholders with agile development process
* Proficient in creating wireframes, UX design tools and prototyping
* A strong portfolio of work that demonstrates your design thinking, process, and solutions as it relates to web-based products or mobile applications that with complexities
* Good communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills in English
* Worked with enterprise products or B2B domain as a big plus


 The Enterprise Product Designer is an experienced problem solver for the areas with high complexity. He/she will work closely with Product stakeholders to collaborate and execute on the product team’s roadmap and milestones.
   

  

 The Enterprise Product Designer also possesses domain knowledge and expertise of the enterprise products or initiatives, to co-create future partner-centric product strategy or roadmap with your stakeholders. He/she will lead by creating alignment, telling compelling and persuasive stories to illustrate hotel partners’ problems connected with enterprise business journey, clearly articulate design decisions, driving and pushing for optimal UX solutions to stakeholders and influence the enterprise business for the longer term visions.
   

  

**Role Responsibility:**
* You will deliver hands-on design solutions for moderately complex enterprise business scenarios and well-defined business problems, aligning with property partners’ vision and our business goals.
* You will actively engage in research and collaborate with our researcher to evaluate the impact of proposed solutions, driving improvements and refinements towards achieving desired outcomes in property partner-facing products.
* You will acquire deep domain knowledge in both B2B and B2C aspects of the OTA (Online Travel Agency) business through daily collaboration with product leaders, analyzing research insights, and working closely with product stakeholders.
* You will represent ‘Agoda Design’ by advocating user-centric design principles and engaging with external property partner touchpoints.
* You will collaborate with product stakeholders to drive continuous discovery processes, validating and shaping ideas to experiment with and build upon, thereby influencing enterprise product strategy and roadmap.


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

****Discover More About Working At Agoda****
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: UX Research Lead | Candy Crush Soda Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are seeking a highly experienced UX Research Lead to join the Candy Crush Soda team. This role will be responsible for centralizing UX research efforts, optimizing research operations, and driving a cohesive research strategy that aligns with Soda’s business goals. The UX Research Lead will manage a team of researchers, prioritize research initiatives, and foster the craft development of the UX Research team.
   

  

**Your Role Within Our Kingdom**
 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Strategic Leadership: Establish and drive a centralized UX research strategy and roadmap for Candy Crush Soda. Develop clear prioritization frameworks to allocate research resources effectively based on business needs and impact.
* Team Management & Craft Growth: Provide direct line management, career development support, and performance coaching to UX researchers, ensuring a strong research team culture. Foster the development of the UX Research craft by implementing structured learning opportunities, mentorship programs, and best practice sharing.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner closely with game designers, product managers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to ensure research insights drive product innovation.
* Standardization & Best Practices: Define and uphold high-quality research standards, ensuring consistent methodologies, reporting, and impact measurement.
* Communication & Advocacy: Champion user research within the organization, advocating for a player-centric approach to decision-making and product design.


**Skills & Experience**
* Extensive experience in UX research, ideally within gaming or mobile applications.
* Proven track record of leading and growing UX research teams.
* Strong ability to collaborate, influence, and drive alignment across multiple teams and stakeholders.
* Expertise in a wide range of qualitative and quantitative research methodologies.
* Experience in setting up research operations, including tooling, documentation, and resource planning.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Backend Developer - User Platform
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to join our User Platform team in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you will have the opportunity to work at the forefront of digital media, develop the platform to meet the challenges of a continuously growing user base. You will be working with backend services for user authentication & identity management and in-product communications, responsible for in-product messaging to the various Viaplay clients. We are now looking for a new team member to help us grow the platform, enhance our user experience and create the next generation of streaming services.
   

  

 We thrive in using cutting edge technology, always keeping up to date and constantly challenging the status quo. We work mainly with Node.js in a micro-services architecture that runs in AWS. Some of our high load services are written in Rust running on AWS Lambda.
   

  

**The journey ahead**
 You will join a kick-ass and stability cross-functional small but mighty squad team delivering engineering solutions aligned with technical and product long-term visions. The team delivers clear goals based on our customer journey and is focusing on the customer authentication journey but has other responsibilities within our core services.
   

  

**Some Of Your Daily Challenges Will Include**
* Running and taking ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaboration with other teams in an exciting and agile development process
* Participating in weekly backend guild meetings with discussions around best practices, maintenance, and long-term vision
* Writing clean, reusable, legible code that is easy to test and easy to extend
* Investing in our personal skills and increasing our knowledge every day


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we are looking for a passionate developer with a genuine interest in software development and an ambition to constantly improve your skills. You have worked with a variety of tasks requiring complex problem-solving using JavaScript. If you also have an interest in multiple programming languages, you will fit right in! You will be part of a team that makes things happen in a brilliant manner.
   

  

**Desired Skills**
* Solid work life experience developing web based services, using Node.js
* Good understanding of REST API’s
* Understanding of test- or behavior-driven development (TDD/BDD) including supporting frameworks
* Experience in developing services in the cloud, preferably AWS
* An interest and motivation to work with modern frameworks


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience working with a state-less and high transactional end user product
* Knowledge of the AWS environment and services (S3, SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc)
* Knowledge of RUST
* A can-do attitude, sense of humor and the ability to work humbly with others


**What We Offer You**
* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:

To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions.
