title: Cloud Solution Architect - Azure Data & Analytics
description:
**Overview**  

Join Us on an Exciting Journey in Cloud, Data & AI! The pace of innovation has never been more exciting—and we’re right at the heart of it. We’re looking for a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) with a focus on Data & Analytics to join our Customer Success Organization in Sweden. In this role, you’ll work with a wide range of customers and use cases, leveraging the latest technologies to deliver real impact. You’ll be part of a dynamic, collaborative team of experienced and supportive colleagues who are passionate about driving success and innovation. With more than 45,000 employees and partners worldwide, the Customer Experience and Success (CE&S) organization is on a mission to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. We drive cross-company alignment and execution, ensuring that we consistently exceed customers’ expectations in every interaction, whether in-product, digital, or human-centered. CE&S is responsible for all up services across the company, including consulting, customer success, and support across Microsoft’s portfolio of solutions and products. Join CE&S and help us accelerate AI transformation for our customers and the world. As a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) specialized in Data & Analytics you will get to help customers build secure, scalable, and AI-ready solutions on Microsoft Azure. In this customer-facing role, you’ll deliver engagements that span architecture design, production deployments and operational development ensuring performance, resiliency, and security across mission-critical workloads and use cases. You will leverage existing Repeatable IPs, execution engines, and your expert guidance to accelerate customer satisfaction and adoption focusing on services like Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Azure Databricks, Azure Databases, and Purview. You’ll collaborate with local colleagues and global engineering teams, sharing best practices and staying current with evolving trends to help customers unlock the full value of their data and AI investments. Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

- Engage with customer IT/business leaders and technical specialists to understand their data estate, priorities, and success measures, and design secure, scalable Data & Analytics solutions that deliver measurable business value. - Lead architecture design sessions, develop Data & Analytics roadmaps, and drive technical- and organizational development for customers to accelerate adoption and ensure long-term technical viability. - Own the end-to-end technical delivery results, ensuring completeness and accuracy of consumption and customer success plans in collaboration with colleagues. - Drive technical excellence by leading the health-, resiliency, security, and optimization of mission-critical data workloads, ensuring readiness for production-scale Data & Analytics use cases. - Identify and resolve technical blockers, share customer feedback with engineering teams, and influence product improvements through Voice of the Customer insights. - Deliver- and contribute to repeatable intellectual property (IP) to achieve targeted customer outcomes and to accelerate Azure consumption. - Provide delivery oversight and escalation support for key Factory engagements across Data & Analytics workloads. - Maintain deep technical expertise and stay current with market trends, competitive insights, and Microsoft’s evolving Data and Analytics capabilities. - Be accredited and certified to deliver with advanced and expert-level proficiency in priority workloads including Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Purview, Azure SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Cosmos DB. - Demonstrate a growth mindset by continuously aligning your skills to team and customer needs, contributing to technical communities, and mentoring others to accelerate customer outcomes.  

  

**Qualifications**  

Required Qualifications (RQs) - Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting - OR equivalent experience - Technical expertise in Data & Analytics technologies including for example Spark, Python, and SQL as well as modern architecture such as for example Lakehouse and Medallion - Technical expertise in databases such as for example SQL DB, NoSQL DB, and Open Source DBs - Experience of a customer-facing role (internal or external) - Fluent in of both Swedish and English - spoken and written - Currently based in Sweden Preferred Qualifications (PQs) - Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting - OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting - OR equivalent experience - Knowledge of the Microsoft Data & Analytics portfolio, including for example services such as Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Azure Databricks, Azure Databases, and Purview - Technical expertise in Power BI - Knowledge in Cloud compute, storage, networking, devops, and security - Technical Certifications in Cloud, Data, and Security (e.g., Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Industry-wide) Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.  

  

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

  

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about **requesting accommodations.**

title: Entry level Software Engineer to Coretura – AI Specialist Program
description:
*At* ***Coretura****, you’ll be part of a team that’s redefining how commercial vehicle technology is built. As a joint venture between Volvo Group and Daimler Truck, Coretura combines the speed and creativity of a startup with the strength of global industry leaders. If you’re passionate about coding, eager to learn, and ready to apply AI in real-world projects, this is your chance to make an impact from day one.*

**ABOUT THE TALENT PROGRAM**


The AI Specialist Program is a 12-month journey run by Hubbau in collaboration with TokenTek and Coretura. During the program, you’ll be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant at Coretura. After the program, the ambition is that you continue your journey as a Coretura employee.


During the year, you will go through a training program together with TokenTek that will take you from n00b to expert in building and using AI tools. Our goal is to give you a fun, challenging and rewarding first year in tech, one that builds both your technical depth and professional confidence. The program combines deep technical knowledge with hands-on experience, taking you from AI fundamentals to advanced real-world projects.


**Start:** February 3rd, 2026


**Location:** Lindholmen, Gothenburg  

  

**THIS IS CORETURA**

**Coretura** is redefining the future of commercial vehicles—and you can be part of it. The company is building an open, standardized digital platform and operating system that will power next-generation of commercial vehicles and connected mobility solutions.


At Coretura, AI is more than a buzzword, it’s embedded in the company’s DNA. Developers collaborate with advanced AI tools such as GitHub Copilot and Claude Code to accelerate processes from test creation to full implementation. Engineers concentrate on strategy, innovation, and problem-solving, while AI manages repetitive and time-consuming tasks. This approach represents the future of software development—and it’s a reality at Coretura every single day.

**DESCRIPTION OT THE ROLES**


At Coretura you will belong to one of their software development teams but also regularly collaborate on projects with people across the organisation. As Coretura is a young, fast-growing and dynamic company, roles and responsibilities aren’t set in stone but will change and develop over time. Their tech stack is based on C++ for real-time systems, Rust for safety-critical apps and Python for automation.


For this talent program we are looking for people with an interest in applying their skills in one or several of the areas below:


* Automating test frameworks, predictive failure analysis, and intelligent validation.
* Build data pipelines, prepare AI-ready datasets, and learn cloud-native architectures for scalable AI solutions.
* Apply AI for threat detection, compliance monitoring, and optimize code for better performance and user experience.
* Enhancing user experience and system integration through AI-powered interfaces and code optimization.

**CANDIDATE PROFILE**


We’re looking for curious, driven and humble engineers who want to take the first real step into the world of AI. You’re passionate about technology, problem- solving and eager to learn how AI can be applied in practice, from generative models to agent-based systems and multimodal architectures.


You enjoy working together with others and want to grow in an environment where learning and innovation go hand in hand.


* You are a recent graduate with a master’s degree in computer science, information technology or a similar field
* You’re a skilled developer with experience in C++ and Python, Rust is a plus
* You have experience using AI tools from either thesis projects or other school courses
* You’re curious, motivated and enjoy learning with others
* English language communication skills, oral and in writing. Swedish language is a big plus
* Bonus points if you’ve built personal software projects

**About Hubbau**
  

Hubbau helps companies find, onboard, develop, and retain young engineers so that critical expertise is built internally.


Hubbau offers tailor-made training from specialists in various fields, enabling companies to own and further develop their competencies in the long term.


More info: hubbau.se


**About TokenTek**
  

TokenTek helps organizations move from pilot projects to fully functioning AI solutions that create real value in everyday operations. More info: tokentek.ai

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this Opportunity**  

At Mobile Financial Services, we believe in using technology to create opportunities for everyone. Through our solutions, we enable financial inclusion for millions of people every day, empowering them with services like money transfers, payments, disbursements, loans, and savings. The Ericsson Wallet Platform (EWP) supports operators and banks in delivering secure and reliable mobile financial services that transform communities across Africa, the Middle East, and beyond.  

We are looking for a Solution Architect (with a strong Access Module focus) to join our team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our adaptation and engineering experts to design, develop, and deliver solutions that address real-world challenges. You’ll play a key part in guiding technical design decisions, ensuring architectural consistency, and continuously improving our frameworks and processes.

 **What You Will Do**  

* Work with engineering and software architecture teams to design solutions that meet ADM requirements and align with project strategies.
* Analyze customer needs from LLD/HLD documentation and propose effective, forward-thinking solutions.
* Develop implementation proposals ensuring alignment with established design principles.
* Perform and oversee unit and component testing across various environments (IAT, SIT, UAT, production).
* Apply secure coding practices to maintain system integrity.
* Document workflows and code to ensure clarity, maintenance, and scalability.
* Support acceptance testing, go-live activities, and smooth operational handovers.
* Manage tasks and progress in Jira within SDLC timelines.
 **You Will Bring**  

* A degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent professional experience.
* Strong analytical skills for solving complex problems and designing optimal solutions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective teamwork across multiple stakeholders.
* Experience and knowledge of EWP, including AM FE, AM BE, and EWP frameworks.
* Proficiency in Java/J2EE, Spring, Hibernate, and Web Services.
* Hands-on experience with microservices, Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm.
* Understanding of IP and cloud technologies.
* Working knowledge of Agile methodologies.
* Strong troubleshooting skills and configuration management expertise.
* Ability to prioritize, adapt to change, and drive team efficiency.
* A passion for knowledge sharing, mentoring, and contributing to a collaborative culture.
**Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail. We target 60% work-from-office.  

Last day to apply: 10th of December 2025  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com


Location: Karlskrona, Sweden

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Karlskrona

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
Responsibilities:
 



 1. Responsible for training of agents, including training on products, installation and implementation, after-sales problem solving, robot uses and other related functions.
 



 2. Maintain customer relationships; provide technical support, including remote guidance, on-site solution of after-sales problems and needs, to ensure customer satisfaction.
 



 3. Accompany with sales personnel to visit customers and provide on-site technical support; travel independently to conduct installation and implementation training for agents.
 



 4. Continuously follow up the use of products to improve customers' product usage.
 



 5. Provide technical support for the promotion of new products. For example, demonstrate new product functions, build demonstration platform, assist sales engineers to carry out technical communication with customers.
 



 6. Responsible for the output of technical documents, including configuration scheme, implementation scheme, trouble-shooting manual, etc.
 



 7. Continuously follow up the quality performance of products and put forward suggestions for technical improvements.
 



  





 工作职责:
 



 1、负责代理商培训，包含产品，安装实施，售后问题处理，机器人使用以及其他相关功能的培训；
 



 2、负责客户关系维护，向客户提供技术支持，包括远程指导或现场解决客户售后问题或需求，提升客户满意度；
 



 3、陪同销售到客户现场拜访客户，提供现场技术支持；独立出差到现场，对代理商进行安装实施培训，进行技术交流，安装部署等；
 



 4、持续跟踪产品使用状况，提升客户产品使用率；
 



 5、为公司新产品的推广工作提供技术支持。如展示新产品功能，搭建演示平台，协助销售工程师与客户进行技术交流；
 



 6、负责相关技术文档撰写；包括配置方案、实施方案、故障手册等，并翻译成对应外语；
 



 7、持续跟踪产品的质量状况，不断提出技术改进建议。
 



  





  





 Requirements:
 



 1. Bachelor's degree in science and engineering preferred, English and Chinese can be used as working language.
 



 2. Minimum 1 year of technical or after-sales team management experience in Mechanical automation industry is preferred.
 



 3. Strong sense of responsibility, detail-oriented, strong execution ability, and adaptability to frequent business trips or stationing.
 



  





 任职资格:
 



 1、本科及以上学历，英语和中文能作为日常工作语言者；
 



 2、理工科背景，1年以上机械自动化行业相关工作经验者优先；
 



 3、吃苦耐劳，积极主动，具有较好的亲和力和团队合作精神，有相关售后服务经验者优先；
 



 4、责任感强，注重细节，强大的落地执行能力

title: Senior IT-Operations Specialist
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


 As a Senior IT-Operations Specialist, you will balance a mix of both technical support and system administration, ensuring the smooth operation of both end-user devices and network infrastructure. You will be responsible for troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues across a multi-operating system environment, including Microsoft Windows, macOS, and Linux (a small minority). Additionally, you will play a key role in onboarding new employees, provisioning system accounts, maintaining IT inventory, and managing vendor relationships, all while ensuring compliance with ISO standards.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* End-User Support – provide IT support for employees..
* New Employee Onboarding – set up and configure laptops, user accounts, and system access for new hires, ensuring a smooth onboarding experience.
* Network & System Administration – configure and troubleshoot routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless access points.
* User Account & Access Management – provision and deactivate system accounts, email accounts, and application access, ensuring ISO compliance
* Hardware & Software Inventory Management – maintain an up-to-date inventory of IT assets, including laptops, peripherals, and software licenses
* Software & License Management – purchase, renew, and track software licenses and IT assets to ensure compliance and availability
* Vendor & Procurement Management – coordinate with vendors for hardware/software purchases, IT services, and contract renewals
* System Security & Compliance – ensure IT operations align with ISO certification requirements, access control policies, security best practices, and IT governance
* Documentation & Process Improvement – maintain IT documentation, update asset records, and contribute to process enhancements to meet compliance and audit requirements


**What You Bring In**
* Strong Communication & Customer Service Skills – ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users and provide excellent support
* IT Support & Troubleshooting Expertise – proven ability to provide IT support in a multi-OS environment (Windows, macOS, Linux) with a strong understanding of hardware, software, and peripheral troubleshooting
* Systems Administration Knowledge – hands-on experience managing user accounts, system access, and authentication protocols (Active Directory, Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, or similar)
* Networking Knowledge & Administration – understanding of network fundamentals, including LAN management, VLAN configuration, switch setup, and WiFi network troubleshooting
* Network Monitoring & Troubleshooting – ability to monitor network performance, diagnose LAN issues, and resolve connectivity problems


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Basic knowledge of GCP - be able to conduct access reviews, provisioning of access and similar administrative tasks.
* Firewall & Security Awareness – familiarity with pfSense or similar firewall solutions for managing network security and traffic rules
* Virtualization & Infrastructure – understanding of virtual machines (VMs) and experience with Xen or similar virtualization platform


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc
 **.** 
 All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
