title: Fullstack Engineer (Team Scale: App Success)
description:
**Tl;dr:** We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who loves building rails that help our users grow their own apps. One month you’ll ship tools that make it easy to add SEO, email journeys, and shareable previews. The next, you’ll deepen payments, subscriptions, and analytics so builders can turn usage into revenue. You think in code, but your instinct is always: will this help our users’ apps grow and succeed?

**Coding skills + excellent taste + growth instincts + product obsession = you.**

**Why Lovable?**
----------------


Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.


We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.

**What we’re looking for**
--------------------------

* 5+ years of experience building and growing products with high-performing teams
* Strong SEO and web-performance instincts, with a track record of improving traffic or indexation.
* Comfortable with analytics, attribution, and A/B testing to understand and improve funnels.
* Enjoys designing reusable growth and monetization tools for builders, with a pragmatic and detail-oriented mindset.
* Motivated by technology that makes a difference and by seeing impact through measurable results

**What you’ll do**
------------------


In one sentence: You will build the distribution and monetization infrastructure that helps Lovable builders bring traffic to their apps and turn it into revenue.

* Build shared features that let users add SEO, sharing, and growth hooks to their apps.
* Create systems for email and lifecycle campaigns so users can launch targeted journeys with our AI agent.
* Develop monetization flows for user apps such as payments, subscriptions, and access control.
* Build analytics and attribution foundations so builders can understand and improve their funnels.
* Keep the product experience relentlessly Lovable while making growth the engine, not the afterthought.

**Our tech stack**
------------------


We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:

* Frontend: React
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, infra-as-code (Terraform)


And always on the lookout for what's next!

**How applying works**

* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* Join us for a round of technical interviews
* Team intro calls with the team

**About your application**
--------------------------


Please submit your application in English — it’s our company language.  

We treat all candidates equally, so please apply through our careers portal.


Apply by clicking the link below.

title: Junior DevOps Engineer
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och nyfiken Junior DevOps Engineer till ett spännande konsultuppdrag hos en ledande kund inom försvarsindustrin. Här blir du en del av ett dynamiskt team med en informell och prestigelös kultur, där samarbete och tekniskt intresse står i centrum. Uppdraget passar dig som vill utvecklas brett inom DevOps, trivs i en roll nära både utveckling och drift, och vill bidra till system som används dygnet runt av det svenska flygvapnet.

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

I rollen kommer du bland annat att:

* Delta i utvecklingen av ett molnbaserat system och bidra till systemutformning, integration, konfiguration och driftsättning.
* Designa, bygga och underhålla infrastruktur och automatiserade flöden.
* Vara en central brygga mellan utveckling, drift och molnfunktionalitet för att säkerställa stabila, spårbara och effektiva leveranser.
* Stödja utvecklare genom att säkerställa att byggmiljöer, pipelines och releaseprocesser fungerar som de ska.
* Arbeta med loggning, monitorering och förbättring av systemprestanda.
* Delta i utprovning, support och kundkontakter.

**Kvalifikationer**

*Skall-krav:*

* 1–3 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, gärna med DevOps-inriktning.
* Erfarenhet av Java och microtjänstbaserade system.
* Erfarenhet av DevOps/DevSecOps och CI/CD.
* Goda kunskaper i Linux.
* Erfarenhet av GitHub, GitLab eller motsvarande versionshanteringsverktyg.
* God kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.

*Meriterande:*

* Erfarenhet av VMware, Jenkins, Ansible eller Artifactory.
* Kunskaper i skriptspråk såsom Python eller Bash.
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes eller annan container- och orkestreringsplattform.
* Erfarenhet av OpenSearch, Grafana eller motsvarande monitoreringslösningar.
* Vana av att skapa och felsöka skript samt automatiserade byggflöden.
* Erfarenhet från internationell miljö.

**Villkor**  

Start: 14 januari 2026  

Omfattning: Heltid, 100%  

Placering: Stockholm, 100% på plats  

Säkerhetsprövning enligt gällande bestämmelser kan komma att göras på kundens begäran.


Urval sker löpande. Skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.  

Q har kollektivavtal och är medlem i branschorganisationen Almega, Tech Sverige samt i Svenskt Näringsliv. Företaget erbjuder interims- och rekryteringslösningar inom branscherna IT, teknik, administration, ekonomi, industri samt lager/logistik med personallösningar inom olika befattningsnivåer.

**Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post på grund av GDPR.**  

**För att din ansökan ska kunna behandlas ber vi dig därför att skicka in den via vår karriärsida**

title: Fullstackdeveloper
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* 8+ years as an Application Developer or Architect.
* Expert-level proficiency in Java and Spring Boot.
* Solid, hands-on experience with AWS cloud services and architecture.
* Good working knowledge of React, TypeScript/JavaScript.
* Familiarity with state management (Redux) and GraphQL.
* Proven experience with test automation and frameworks (Jest, Cypress).


  

**Meritorious**  

* Strong communication and collaborative mindset.
* DevOps/CI/CD pipelines.
* MongoDB, Docker, Git.
* Fluent English.

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 23-11-2025  


  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Scrum Master
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet
* Ska ha arbetat i rollen som Scrum Master för utvecklingsteam i PEGA-miljö.
* Ska kunna prata flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Ska ha erfarenhet av att arbeta med agil leverans inom SAFe-ramverket.

Ska ha erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure DevOps.  
* 

  

  

**Meriterande**  

* Certifiering som Scrum master enligt SAFe-ramverket.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med digitalisering av verksamhetsprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom myndighet.
* Flera års erfarenhet av projektledning för komplicerade projekt inom finansiell sektor.

  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 24-11-2025 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Systemarkitekt
description:
**Ska-krav:**

* Minst tio (10) års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete i rollen som Systemarkitekt.

  

* Minst fem (5) års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med frontendutveckling i Jasmine och Angular med TypeScript samt tillhörande ramverk och bibliotek, såsom RxJS och LoDash.

  

* Minst fem (5) års dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling och dokumentation av API:er, inklusive arbete med:
* SOAP och XML, inklusive XSD
* ReST och JSON
* OpenAPI-standarder

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med utveckling kopplat till TakeCare Intelligence inom regional sjukvård.

  

* Erfarenhet av backendutveckling i .NET-miljö innefattande arbete med:
* C#
* .NET Core/.NET Framework
* LINQ
* T-SQL mot SQL Server

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utveckla och testa hjälp av enhetstestning


(exempelvis xUnit, Reqnroll eller motsvarande ramverk).  

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med versionshantering och samarbetsutveckling i Git och GitHub-miljö.

**Meriterande:**  

* dokumenterad erfarenhet av vård-IT samt standarder innefattande nationella kvalitetsregister, FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) och RIV-TA (RIV Tekniska anvisningar).

  

* dokumenterad erfarenhet av säkerhet och autentisering. Detta ska innefatta arbete med OAuth2 och OpenID samt PKI (Public Key Infrastructure) och certifikat.

  

* dokumenterad erfarenhet av systemutveckling, arkitektur och DevOps innefattande arbete med MVC (ModelView-Controller), Web Forms, Docker samt system byggda med stored procedures.

  

* dokumenterad erfarenhet av AI-assisterad utveckling för hälso- och sjukvård.

  

**Var god förklara hur du uppfyller alla kraven.**  

  

**Omfattning:** 100%  

**Ort:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 01-01-2026-30-06-2026  

**Sista ansökningdag: 30-11-2025**  

  

*Vi presenterar löpande. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.*

title: DevOps/Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Terraform
* Serverless framework /Cloudformation
* Gitlab + Gitlab runners windows/linux
* Containerisering med docker

title: Cloud Engineer till Predictly
description:
Bygg framtidens molnlösningar med Predictly! Som Cloud Engineer växer du med ett seniort, nyfiket team och tar ansvar för arkitektur, automation och skalbara system. Ansök idag!
 



  





**Vilka är Predictly?** 




 Predictly är ett konsultbolag med bred specialistkompetens inom digital transformation. Vi arbetar med allt från molnteknik (Google Cloud, AWS och Azure), data engineering och avancerad analys till fullstackutveckling, integration, AI-lösningar och infrastruktur som kod. Våra team består av erfarna och nyfikna specialister som brinner för teknik, innovation och att skapa verkligt affärsvärde.
 



  





 Hos Predictly får du arbeta nära seniora kollegor med djup kompetens genom hela systemutvecklingens livscykel och ta del av skräddarsydd kompetensutveckling baserad på dina mål och intresseområden. I kombination med generösa Work/Life-balance-policys och ett modernt kontor på Birger Jarlsgatan i centrala Stockholm erbjuder vi en arbetsmiljö där både människor och teknik får utrymme att växa.
 



  





**Vad ingår i rollen?** 




 Som Cloud Engineer hos Predictly är du med och bygger, migrerar och vidareutvecklar moderna och skalbara molnlösningar. Du arbetar brett – från IAM, nätverk och säkerhet till övervakning, CI/CD, containerhantering och orkestrering med Kubernetes (exempelvis GKE). Du skapar stabila pipelines i GitLab eller GitHub, använder verktyg som ArgoCD för deployment och jobbar kontinuerligt med automation och infrastruktur som kod.
 



  





 Beroende på erfarenhet får du även möjlighet att axla ansvarsfulla roller, exempelvis Lead Engineer eller Cloud Architect, och vara drivande i arkitektur- och teknikbeslut hos kund.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:
 



  




* En relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arbete med GCP, AWS eller Azure
* God förståelse för molnarkitektur, nätverk, säkerhet och IAM
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Kubernetes, gärna i GKE
* Kunskap om CI/CD och erfarenhet av pipelines i GitLab CI/CD eller GitHub Actions
* Erfarenhet av containerhantering och deploymentverktyg som ArgoCD
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Terraform
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* EU-medborgarskap



  





 Vi tror dessutom att du är trygg i rollen, trivs i moderna arbetsmiljöer och är van vid att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och gillar att lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar.
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du har:
 


* Erfarenhet från flera molnplattformsprojekt; från krav till ny- och vidareutveckling.
* Vana att arbeta enligt agila metoder



  





 Har du tagit dig hela vägen hit? Då är chansen stor att du är precis den vi letar efter. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





 Observera att Envoke Talent håller i rekryteringsprocessen men du blir anställd hos Predictly.
 



  





 Så här ser rekryteringsprocessen ut:
 



  




1. Vi går igenom hur din profil matchar rollen
2. Passar du in? Då bjuds du in till intervju med oss på Envoke Talent
3. Eventuellt arbetsprov och sedan intervju med rekryterande chef
4. Rätt match? Då väntar ett nytt jobb på dig!



  





 Om du inte går vidare i just denna rekrytering behåller vi gärna dina uppgifter för framtida möjligheter som bättre matchar din profil.
 



  





 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
*Vill du arbeta med modern molndrift, automatisering och containerplattformar i en av Sveriges mest besökta digitala miljöer? Hos oss får du chansen att bidra till en stabil och skalbar plattform som driver några av Sveriges mest populära webbplatser och finansiella appar.* 




  





*Vi söker nu en Cloud Engineer med fokus på Google Cloud Platform (GCP) och Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) – en nyckelroll för att vidareutveckla och drifta vår molnplattform.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Cloud Engineer arbetar du nära våra utvecklingsteam för att designa, drifta och optimera molnbaserade system. Du säkerställer att våra tjänster är tillgängliga, säkra och effektiva – samtidigt som du driver automatisering och förbättringar i vår GCP-miljö.
 



  





**Du kommer bland annat att:** 



* Designa, implementera och underhålla lösningar i GCP
* Drifta och optimera applikationer och infrastruktur i GKE
* Bygga och förbättra CI/CD-flöden för deployment och skalning
* Automatisera infrastruktur med Terraform och GitOps-principer
* Arbeta med observability, säkerhet och kostnadsoptimering i molnet



  





 Du blir en del av vårt AppOps-team, ett sammansvetsat gäng med 6 erfarna kollegor som tillsammans ansvarar för driften av våra system. Vi arbetar idag med Python, Terraform, Ansible och Puppet, och uppmuntrar ständigt till att utforska nya verktyg och tekniker som förbättrar vår leverans.
 



  





**Din profil:** 




 För att passa i rollen tror vi att du trivs med att ta dig an komplexa problem och har en stark teknisk nyfikenhet. Du är självgående och tar ansvar för ditt arbete, samtidigt som du värdesätter samarbete och att bidra tillsammans med andra. Du motiveras av att skapa smarta och hållbara lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad i vår verksamhet.
 



  





**Vidare tror vi att du har:** 



* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arbete i molnbaserade Linux-miljöer, med erfarenhet av GCP och GKE
* Erfarenhet av containerisering och Kubernetes, inklusive deployment och drift i GKE
* Goda kunskaper i Infrastructure as Code, t.ex. Terraform, Ansible eller liknande
* Förståelse för nätverk, säkerhet och övervakning i molnmiljöer
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av GCP-tjänster som Cloud Run, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, Monitoring eller IAM
* Programmering i Python eller annat scriptspråk
* Automatisering och pipeline-byggande i CI/CD



  





 Hos oss får du kombinera teknisk fördjupning med verklig påverkan. Du blir en del av en kultur präglad av innovation, samarbete och högt engagemang – där du tar ansvar för våra system från kod till drift och får utrymme att påverka både teknikval och arbetssätt.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka in din ansökan via "Ansök nu"-knappen i annonsen. Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta Erik Wikner, Engineering Manager, på erik.wikner@avanza.se.
 



*Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt kontakt från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.*

title: Cloud Presales Engineer (Sweden)
description:
CloudZone is a global leader in multi-cloud services and a top-tier partner of AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. With over 14 years of expertise, we excel in helping companies maximize the full potential of their cloud investments, delivering exceptional business outcomes with efficiency and precision. What truly sets CloudZone apart is our awesome vibe, outside-the-box thinking, colorful professionalism, and unwavering customer obsession.
 



  





**Sounds exciting** 
 ? Then keep reading because we’re on the hunt for a talented, experienced, hands-on
 **Cloud Presales Engineer** 
 to lead CloudZone’s expansion in Sweden.
 



  





 We are seeking a dynamic
 **Cloud Presales Engineer** 
 who combines deep technical knowledge with strong business acumen to act as the primary technical advocate for CloudZone in the Nordics and Benelux markets. This role is all about supporting our sales efforts by bridging complex cloud solutions with client business needs, helping drive growth, and accelerating deal closures through technical engagements.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead technical discovery sessions and accurately gather customer requirements.
* Identify new opportunities, market segments, and customer needs within the region.
* Design tailored managed service cloud solutions, creating impactful demos that highlight business value.
* Collaborate closely with the sales team to develop compelling proposals, project plans, and Proof of Concepts.
* Act as a trusted advisor, simplifying complex cloud architectures into clear, strategic business outcomes.
* Build and maintain trusted partnerships with AWS and Google Cloud to unlock co-selling opportunities, drive mutual business plans, and ensure a consistent pipeline.
* Promote CloudZone’s value at industry events and customer meetings.



  





**What You Bring** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in presales, solutions consulting, or technical sales support in cloud or enterprise environments.
* Deep understanding of Cloud providers (AWS, GCP), architecture, and networking, with relevant certifications preferred.
* Proven ability to architect solutions and run successful PoCs tailored to client business challenges.
* Excellent communication skills to articulate technical solutions to both technical and executive audiences.
* Entrepreneurial, proactive approach with a passion to impact customer success and growth.
* **Fluent English** 
 ; Swedish language skills are a strong advantage.



  





**Why CloudZone?** 



* Join a high-growth company where innovation and trust are at the core.
* Collaborate with cloud leaders and industry visionaries.
* Shape CloudZone’s brand and success in one of Europe’s most dynamic markets.
* Enjoy autonomy, visible impact, and clear room for advancement.



  





**This role is 60% remote, with in-person presence required twice a week at our partners’ offices or at our shared workspace.**

title: System Engineer
description:
**Contract / Freelance Opportunity - Sweden (multiple locations) - Hybrid working - Immediate start** 




  





 I am working with a longstanding client of mine that are looking for a Systems Engineer to support with an upgrade initiative for innovative Remote Tower System (RTS/RTC) platforms.
 



  





 If successful you will be supporting requirements engineering, system architecture analysis, change implementation, system validation and documentation. The work focuses on system-level engineering as a supporting role to their existing hardware and software development teams to ensure that functionality, interfaces, usability and system performance comply with operational, technical and regulatory requirements.
 



  





 You must have previous experience working with RTS/RTC systems and preferably some knowledge of ATC systems.
 



  





**Mandatory requirements:** 



* Swedish citizenship + ability to pass Security Vetting Level 2
* Fluent Swedish (spoken & written)
* 3+ years hands-on RTC/RTS experience (architecture, functionality, HMI)
* Requirements engineering for real-time or safety-critical systems
* System validation and operational testing
* Technical documentation and system review
* Ability to work independently and lead a small work area



  





**Additional experience:** 



* Demonstrated understanding of
 **RTC network architecture** 
 , including:
* VLAN segmentation
* Redundant routing
* Streaming video bandwidth constraints
* Cybersecurity zones and access control
* Performance monitoring of real-time data paths



  





 Please reach out for more details and a full job specification!
 



  





**Contract / Freelance Opportunity - Sweden (multiple locations) - Hybrid working - Immediate start**

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the Search Team** 
 are responsible for Spam Detection, AI Identity, Name Resolution, and Fraud Detection. By accurately assigning names to phone numbers, detecting spam and fraud, and providing contextual caller information, we enhance users' trust and safety, empowering them to make informed decisions about incoming calls and directly supporting Truecaller’s mission of enabling safe and trusted communication.
   

  

**As a Data Engineer in the Search team,** 
 you will play an important role in the development of data pipelines, frameworks, and models to support the understanding of our users and make better product decisions. You will contribute to empowering the product teams with a complete self-serve analytics platform by working on scalable and robust solutions while collaborating with data engineers, data scientists, and data analysts across the company.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Play a crucial role in the team and own ETL pipelines
* Build new tools, develop and maintain Truecallers Search features
* Gather and analyze the requirements
* Provide the best tools based on requirements for the team to be able to reach their respective goals
* Make data-driven decisions accompanied by experience
* Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts
* Work on large-scale projects, such as migrating to Google BigQuery and transitioning to cloud-native technologies.


**What You Bring In**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree or equivalent in engineering, computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
* 2+ years of experience in Data Engineering
* Experience working with orchestration tools (eg: Airflow)
* Experience working with big data and ETL development
* Programming skills in SQL, Spark with Scala or Python
* Experience working with cloud computing services (eg, GCP, AWS, Azure)
* Experience with Data Science workflows
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, both with peers and experts from other areas
* Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take the initiative to solve problems


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Experience with Kubernetes
* Ability to orchestrate & develop real-time machine learning pipelines
* Anomaly detection applications
* Real-time validation of data
* Experience with Apache Beam, Apache Flink, or CloudML


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget range.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Data Engineering**

**14 days ago**

title: Backend Engineer with infra experience
description:
The Analytics Platform product area (APPA) is dedicated to empowering every internal user to rapidly make data-driven decisions backed by high-quality insights.
   

  

 Sequel is the team responsible for the tooling and best practices around transforming raw data to consumable analytics through SQL. The team owns the BigQueryRunner (BQR) tool, in-house built, and provides platform support for working with dbt.
   

  

 The customers of the team are primarily Analytics Engineers (AEs) and Data Scientists (DSs), and with the focus on T-shaping we are also seeing Engineers increasingly adopting the tools the team offers.
   

  

 The team is tasked with the following:
   

  

* Maintain the healthy operation of the fleet of scheduled SQL pipelines to ensure proper version management, cost efficiency, security.
* Keep the tools relevant and useful through bugs fixing and new features implementation.
* Support teams that need to migrate their pipelines from non-golden technologies to dbt by building the expected automations and assistance.


 What will the person do?
   

  

* Help manage the fleet of dbt: ensure undisrupted operations (scheduling and execution), up-to-date functionalities and features.
* Help deliver an AI-assisted migration from BigQueryRunner (in-house SQL transformation and scheduling tool) to dbt, powered by Honk, client's agentic coding system.
* Contribute to building data verification loops (tests, lineage, contract checks) that enable agentic and safe migration from BQ Runner to dbt, as well as other changes to data pipelines.
* Help explore open-source and commercial SQL transformation options, as alternatives to dbt-core and perform light-weight technical evaluations and prototyping.


 A successful candidate
   

  

**Skills**
* Fluent in Python, bash scripting, (Java)
* Deep knowledge of the modern analytics data stack (SQL, dbt or other tooling for data pipelines).
* Deep and multi-year knowledge of SQL-like languages and data warehouses like BigQuery.
* Experience with employing AI code assistants to increase own efficiency.
* Familiar with the principles of AI engineering (building products on top of foundational models)
* Hands on experience with agentic systems is a huge plus.


 Team fit
   

  

* Bias for action, ability to keep a high delivery pace and energy.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in distributed teams.
* Able to self-initiate and work in a high-ambiguity environment where understanding and shaping the direction is expected.


 Start/End: 2026-01-05 to 2026-07-04
   

  

 Workplace: Sweden/remote

title: Cloud Solution Architect - Azure Data & Analytics
description:
**Overview**
 Join Us on an Exciting Journey in Cloud, Data & AI! The pace of innovation has never been more exciting—and we’re right at the heart of it. We’re looking for a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) with a focus on Data & Analytics to join our Customer Success Organization in Sweden. In this role, you’ll work with a wide range of customers and use cases, leveraging the latest technologies to deliver real impact. You’ll be part of a dynamic, collaborative team of experienced and supportive colleagues who are passionate about driving success and innovation. With more than 45,000 employees and partners worldwide, the Customer Experience and Success (CE&S) organization is on a mission to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. We drive cross-company alignment and execution, ensuring that we consistently exceed customers’ expectations in every interaction, whether in-product, digital, or human-centered. CE&S is responsible for all up services across the company, including consulting, customer success, and support across Microsoft’s portfolio of solutions and products. Join CE&S and help us accelerate AI transformation for our customers and the world. As a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA) specialized in Data & Analytics you will get to help customers build secure, scalable, and AI-ready solutions on Microsoft Azure. In this customer-facing role, you’ll deliver engagements that span architecture design, production deployments and operational development ensuring performance, resiliency, and security across mission-critical workloads and use cases. You will leverage existing Repeatable IPs, execution engines, and your expert guidance to accelerate customer satisfaction and adoption focusing on services like Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Azure Databricks, Azure Databases, and Purview. You’ll collaborate with local colleagues and global engineering teams, sharing best practices and staying current with evolving trends to help customers unlock the full value of their data and AI investments. Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Engage with customer IT/business leaders and technical specialists to understand their data estate, priorities, and success measures, and design secure, scalable Data & Analytics solutions that deliver measurable business value. - Lead architecture design sessions, develop Data & Analytics roadmaps, and drive technical- and organizational development for customers to accelerate adoption and ensure long-term technical viability. - Own the end-to-end technical delivery results, ensuring completeness and accuracy of consumption and customer success plans in collaboration with colleagues. - Drive technical excellence by leading the health-, resiliency, security, and optimization of mission-critical data workloads, ensuring readiness for production-scale Data & Analytics use cases. - Identify and resolve technical blockers, share customer feedback with engineering teams, and influence product improvements through Voice of the Customer insights. - Deliver- and contribute to repeatable intellectual property (IP) to achieve targeted customer outcomes and to accelerate Azure consumption. - Provide delivery oversight and escalation support for key Factory engagements across Data & Analytics workloads. - Maintain deep technical expertise and stay current with market trends, competitive insights, and Microsoft’s evolving Data and Analytics capabilities. - Be accredited and certified to deliver with advanced and expert-level proficiency in priority workloads including Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Purview, Azure SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Cosmos DB. - Demonstrate a growth mindset by continuously aligning your skills to team and customer needs, contributing to technical communities, and mentoring others to accelerate customer outcomes.


**Qualifications**
 Required Qualifications (RQs)    - Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting - OR equivalent experience - Technical expertise in Data & Analytics technologies including for example Spark, Python, and SQL as well as modern architecture such as for example Lakehouse and Medallion - Technical expertise in databases such as for example SQL DB, NoSQL DB, and Open Source DBs - Experience of a customer-facing role (internal or external) - Fluent in of both Swedish and English - spoken and written - Currently based in Sweden Preferred Qualifications (PQs) - Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting - OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting - OR equivalent experience - Knowledge of the Microsoft Data & Analytics portfolio, including for example services such as Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Azure Databricks, Azure Databases, and Purview - Technical expertise in Power BI - Knowledge in Cloud compute, storage, networking, devops, and security - Technical Certifications in Cloud, Data, and Security (e.g., Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Industry-wide) Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
   

  

 This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about
 **requesting accommodations.**

title: AI & Backend Developers (1 Lead, 1 Trainee)
description:
**1 Lead Backend Developer** 




**1 Trainee Backend Developer** 




  





 Please note that only job candidates with a resolved housing situation for a daily commute to Stockholm city will be considered. Applicant Hybrid workplace can be ok for one - or maybe two - days per week, but most work will be in the office on-site. Preferred start as soon as possible and no cover letter needed so apply now. 
 



  





 We are continuously launching new AI based microservice features. Would you now like to join the skilled and top performing team of Driftio using the latest tools and state of the art practices, enabling a great customer product experience for personal financial data? We are looking for product development-oriented persons willing to take on blood, sweat and tears to become successful with our new global and unique mobile app/web service for consumers to control access of their own personal financial data and to get value back from their own data. We are a team willing to learn about the latest tools and use best practices based on security and efficiency, and we expect you to think in the same manner.
 



  





 It is important that you share our passion for the cause to make people get value back from their own data and that you search for a long-term engagement with a company doing something truly good for consumers, and further like the concept of future commitment with co-ownership as we will scale around the world.
 



  





 In our frontend we use Typescript with Angular framework, HTML and SCSS. Our backend is built in Elixir for top stability, security and scalability. The code is modular using internal and external REST API:s for our SaaS subscription-based client iOS/Android apps and Web service. We are a team willing to learn about the latest tools as well as using established best practices based on security and efficiency, and we expect you to think in the same manner.
 



  
 



**Requirements:** 




 Knowledge of Phyton
 



 Some project experience of DevOps in cloud environment and SQL databases (MySQL or PostgreSQL preferred)
 



 Some project experience of modern front-end framework such as React, Angular, Vue or similar frameworks
 



 Be prepared to work hard until the development milestone and mission is completed
 



  
 



**Qualification experience or knowledge of:** 




 Elixir, Erlang, Haskell, Ruby on rails or other functional programming languages
 



 Integrating LLM, Deep Learning or other AI models
 



 Microservices
 



 Linux/Unix-systems
 



 Containers in cloud environment
 



 Google Cloud, AWS, Azure or similar cloud provider
 



 REST APIs and web services
 



 TypeScript/JavaScript, SCSS, HTML and Redux
 



 Angular
 



 Git
 



 Agile/Scrum methodologies
 



  
 



**Bonus qualifications:** 




 Computer Science Master degree or related computer-oriented fields
 



 Good eye for design and easy to use functionality
 



 Speak and write Swedish and English fluently
 



  
 



**Interest qualifications:** 




 Making the world a better place for the world’s consumers
 



  
 



 We hope to find you as an open-minded developer, tester and problem solver. A good sense for details and a passion for building a user-friendly interface is needed if you like to focus on Frontend. We use agile development and like to contribute to the open-source community if possible.
 



  
 



**Application:** 




 Mail your CV, GitHub or Stack Overflow account and links to sites/apps/services that you have participated to build to info@driftio.com. Grade credentials are a bonus. For any questions, please call Peter Montgomery directly at +46 70-865 05 65.
 



  
 



**About Driftio** 




 We are a small team sitting in the old town of Stockholm and are offering substantial value for consumers when they choose to share their own selected personal financial data. Value can e.g. mean investment insights, P2P loan management, saving education or better deals in larger purchase transactions. Our vision is to help consumers globally to take better financial decisions. We are a GDPR based App and Web service.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* God förståelse för JavaScript
* Erfarenhet av testledning, testdokumentation och testadministration
* Stark automationsexpertis, gärna med Selenium eller Robot Framework
* Kunskap om verktyg som BrowserStack, JIRA, QMetry och Confluence
* Förmåga att tänka kritiskt och analytiskt
* Erfarenhet av webbanalys (meriterande)
* Förmåga att ta ägarskap för QA-processer och samarbeta med stakeholders
* Erfarenhet av Agile/Scrum


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 24-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. We build a Creative Management Platform that allows enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze, and optimize advertising in-house, at scale and across advertising channels.
   

  

 Our agile teams are highly autonomous, collaborative and we are now looking for yet another passionate engineer to join us!
   

  

 ⭐
 **Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer:**
 At Bannerflow, we build flexible and autonomous teams based on trust. We believe that when people are given the freedom to take ownership and work closely together, great things happen. Our engineering culture is shaped by openness, respect, and a shared drive to keep improving.
   

  

 We are passionate about solving real problems and making a meaningful impact, and we are always open to exploring new ideas. With us, you will be part of a growing tech company where ideas are valued, feedback is encouraged, and personal development is supported. We bring the energy of a fast-moving company together with the stability of a proven product and a strong customer base.
   

  

 You will join a team where motivation is high, knowledge is shared openly, and having fun is part of everyday life — whether it’s through hackathons, board game nights, or spontaneous team activities.
   

  

**Our Ever Evolving Tech Stack Currently Consists Of**
* TypeScript / Angular
* C# / .NET
* MongoDB
* Azure & Kubernetes
* …and some more stuff


 🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced and ambitious engineer to join our team and help us continue to deliver the best possible products to our customers. This role is a critical part of our development team and will play a key role in shaping the direction of our technology and ensuring that our products are robust, scalable and secure.
   

  

 So, what are we looking for?
   

  

* >5 years of experience as a software engineer delivering high-quality products
* Strong sense of ownership and personal drive
* Ability to write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
* Excellent communication, collaboration and leadership skills - paring or mobbing fellow developer is just a natural way of working for you
* Passion for mentoring and coaching team members to help them reach their full potential
* Strong interest of the latest technologies, industry trends and best practices to continually improve our products and processes


 At Bannerflow, we live our values of passion, collaboration and challenge in everything we do — from how we build software to how we celebrate success together. As a Software Engineer, you will play a key role in shaping the future of Ad Tech through innovative technology and product excellence. We offer a hybrid work setup, competitive compensation including ITP1 pension, health allowance, parental leave top-up and private health care insurance. We are also deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive team, welcoming applicants from all backgrounds, experiences and abilities. If you are ready to grow, learn and make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the Search Team** 
 are responsible for Spam Detection, AI Identity, Name Resolution, and Fraud Detection. By accurately assigning names to phone numbers, detecting spam and fraud, and providing contextual caller information, we enhance users' trust and safety, empowering them to make informed decisions about incoming calls and directly supporting Truecaller’s mission of enabling safe and trusted communication.
   

  

**As a Senior ML Engineer,** 
 you will be working hands-on to optimise training and deployment of ML models to be quick and cost-efficient. You will also be at the forefront of putting our ML models on mobile devices to enhance data privacy and customer experience. To achieve this, you will need to collaborate with teams across Truecaller to establish best practices and tools for efficient ML model development and deployment, particularly on mobile platforms. You will be expected to help Truecaller reach and stay at the cutting edge of ML training and deployment, as well as explore new frontiers such as federated learning.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organisation, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.
* Work with teams throughout Truecaller, enabling them to put models into production quickly and cost-effectively.
* Work hands-on with teams throughout Truecaller to optimise ML models for mobile devices.
* Be the go-to expert for developing models for mobile devices as well as deploying them.
* Staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in ML Engineering, especially ML on mobile phones, and driving continuous innovation throughout Truecaller.


**What You Bring In**
* Degree in computer science or equivalent
* 5+ years of experience in machine learning engineering, with a focus on deploying ML models in production environments.
* A strong understanding and experience to optimise feature engineering, model training, and model deployment.
* Hands-on experience deploying ML models on mobile devices (e.g., TensorFlow Lite, Core ML, ONNX Runtime Mobile).
* Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX) and their deployment on mobile platforms.
* Understanding of both Android and iOS development and how that impacts ML model deployment and usage.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.
* A customer-focused mindset.
* Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English.


**Life At Truecaller - Behind The Code**
**https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget range.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Data Science**
 Team
