title: NIRA Engineering Summer Internship 2026
description:
### **Spend Your Summer Engineering the Future of Mobility with NIRA Dynamics!**


At NIRA Dynamics, we’re at the cutting edge of embedded and cloud-based software solutions, creating cost-effective, high-impact services for the global vehicle industry. Our software powers over 110 million vehicles, with clients including Audi, Volkswagen, Seat, Skoda, Volvo, and Renault. With over 130 dedicated colleagues and a global reach, NIRA Dynamics is a leader in innovation and reliability for vehicle software.

**About the Internship**


We host the NIRA Engineering Summer Internship each year to bring new talent into our growing team. This internship is designed to immerse you in our core business, offer hands-on engineering experience, and help you start building a strong professional network.


You’ll work on real-world engineering projects involving various exciting challenges. Whether developing onboard systems used by top car manufacturers or advancing cloud-based solutions for autonomous vehicles, you’ll apply your skills in a meaningful way. Project focus areas and technologies are tailored to your studies and interests, and may include **C, C++, MATLAB, Python, Bazel, Jenkins, Java, React.js, k8s, Airflow,** and more.

**Why Intern with Us?**

* **Mentorship**: Receive guidance from experienced engineers
* **Growth**: Learn, innovate, and make an impact in next-generation mobility
* **Flexibility**: Projects suited to your education and interests
* **Community**: Thrive in a collaborative, inclusive environment

**What We’re Looking For**

* **Education**: BSc or MSc student in Applied Physics, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or similar
* **Skills**: Curiosity for technology, problem-solving drive, and a strong academic track record
* **Communication**: Fluent in English (spoken and written), team-oriented, and an effective communicator
* **Independence**: Able to take initiative, turn ideas into action, and work independently

**Application Process**


The selection process is ongoing, so apply early! Our internships are based at our Linköping office and are available to Swedish 3rd to 5th-year university students.

title: Territory Account Executive, Commercial (Sweden)
description:
We're in an unbelievably exciting area of tech and are fundamentally reshaping the data storage industry. Here, you lead with innovative thinking, grow along with us, and join the smartest team in the industry.



This type of work—work that changes the world—is what the tech industry was founded on. So, if you're ready to seize the endless opportunities and leave your mark, come join us.

**WHY PURE**



At Pure, we're on a mission to redefine the future of data, making it faster, smarter, and more effortless for our customers to innovate. Our Enterprise Data Cloud vision unites our portfolio of storage and data services into a single, modern platform that enables organisations to run any workload, across any cloud, with simplicity, efficiency, and sustainability at its core.



As a Territory Account Executive (TAE), you'll play a pivotal role in bringing this vision to life — helping customers unlock the power of their data, modernise their infrastructure, and accelerate transformation. You'll have the autonomy to own a dynamic territory, driving growth across a broad set of customers, from re-engaging dormant relationships to winning new logos.



At Pure, you'll join a culture built on curiosity, innovation, and integrity. We celebrate diverse perspectives, challenge convention, and empower our people to think big, take bold action, and make a measurable impact. This is your opportunity to grow your career with one of the most innovative technology companies in the world and to do work that truly changes how businesses use data to compete and win.


### **THE ROLE**



The Territory Account Executive (TAE) is a key growth role within Pure Storage's Go-To-Market organisation. This position focuses on driving growth across all accounts not currently managed by an Account Executive, including the full install base, dormant accounts, and new inbound opportunities. TAEs are responsible for expanding Pure's footprint, reigniting customer relationships, and capturing new business through a combination of direct engagement and partner collaboration.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* **Drive Account Growth & Pipeline:** Execute sales activities to generate revenue, manage a high-volume pipeline, and contribute to closing deals on a quarterly basis.
* **Execute Outreach & Prospecting:** Perform consistent, high-activity prospecting to penetrate new accounts, reach decision-makers, and learn how to win new business effectively.
* **Support Partner Strategy:** Collaborate closely with Channel Partners and Partner Managers to align on customer engagement and utilize partner resources to advance opportunities.
* **Reactivate Customer Relationships:** Focus on re-engaging dormant or inactive customers by discovering new business use cases and identifying potential refresh and expansion opportunities.
* **Build Foundational Skills:** Develop and deliver proposals and business cases that clearly demonstrate the value of Pure's solutions, supported by internal experts.
* **Maintain Sales Discipline:** Diligently manage sales technology (Salesforce), deliver accurate forecasts, and maintain strong time management to thrive in a fast-paced, team environment.

### **WHAT YOU'LL BRING**


* **Proven Sales Experience:** Demonstrated success in direct, full-lifecycle B2B technology sales with a consistent record of meeting or exceeding sales metrics (KPIs).
* **Language skills:** Proficiency in both Swedish and English.
* **Sales Drive & Motivation:** A high degree of self-motivation, strong time management skills, demonstrates initiative and the drive to learn quickly and succeed across both transactional and early-stage strategic sales motions.
* **Collaborative Mindset:** Demonstrated success working with both internal teams and channel partners to ensure seamless customer engagement and shared goal achievement.
* **Digital Proficiency:** Proficiency with core sales technologies, including Salesforce and G Suite, and an ability to use data to prioritize daily activities.
* **Communication & Presence:** Strong verbal and written communication skills suitable for engaging with business leaders and maintaining professional business relationships.
* **Resilience & Focus:** A competitive, positive attitude combined with strong organizational and time management skills necessary to handle a dynamic, high-activity territory.

### **Nice to Have**


* **Industry Knowledge:** Prior knowledge of the storage industry and familiarity with how data solutions drive business outcomes.
* **Channel Sales Expertise:** Understanding of channel-led sales motions and experience collaborating effectively within the broader partner ecosystem.
* **Sales Training:** Completion of a structured B2B sales methodology training (e.g., Business Value Selling or similar).
* **Digital Tools:** Experience using digital prospecting and engagement tools (e.g., Outreach, LinkedIn Sales Navigator) to accelerate the sales cycle.


#LI-ONSITE

**WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US:**


* **Pure Innovation**: We celebrate those who think critically, like a challenge and aspire to be trailblazers.
* **Pure Growth**: We give you the space and support to grow along with us and to contribute to something meaningful. We have been Named Fortune's Best Large Workplaces in the Bay Area™, Fortune's Best Workplaces for Millennials™ and certified as a Great Place to Work®!
* **Pure Team**: We build each other up and set aside ego for the greater good.


And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources and company-sponsored team events. Check out purebenefits.com for more information.


**ACCOMMODATIONS AND ACCESSIBILITY:**



Candidates with disabilities may request accommodations for all aspects of our hiring process. For more on this, contact us at TA-Ops@purestorage.com if you're invited to an interview.


**OUR COMMITMENT TO A STRONG AND INCLUSIVE TEAM:**



We're forging a future where everyone finds their rightful place and where every voice matters. Where uniqueness isn't just accepted but embraced. That's why we are committed to fostering the growth and development of every person, cultivating a sense of community through our Employee Resource Groups and advocating for inclusive leadership.  

  

Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.

  

**JOIN US AND BRING YOUR BEST.**


**BRING YOUR BOLD.**


**BRING YOUR FLASH.**
company_description: Bring your best. Bring your bold. Pure and simple.

title: Technical Project Coordinator – Store Payments
description:
**Job Description**  

The Store Payments Enablement team is a key part in our Commerce & Payment Area operating within the Product Development & Engineering Center. Our mission is to deliver secure, modular payment solutions that balance cost efficiency with competitive time-to-market delivery. As a global team, we support cards and alternative payment methods across all H&M stores, brands, and markets.


Driven by a passion for payment & checkout technology, we deliver solutions and services that empower our customers and stakeholders.  

  

**ABOUT THE ROLE:**


As a **Technical Project Coordinator/ Technical Engineer**, your task will focus on requirement analysis, testing, configuring, and implementing innovative payment technologies for H&M’s in-store environments worldwide.


You will collaborate with Payment Service Providers (PSPs), technology vendors, and internal cross-functional teams to integrate next-generation payment systems into H&M’s retail ecosystem. The role combines technical expertise with strong coordination and stakeholder management skills, ensuring seamless implementation across markets and systems.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**

* Coordinate and manage technical projects and changes, including process management, system integration, and release coordination.
* Act as a **technical advisor** in vendor selection, procurement processes, and during escalations with PSPs, POS vendors, and other partners.
* Capture, analyze, and document **functional and non-functional requirements** together with business experts, retail leads, and regional teams.
* Support the **implementation, configuration, and integration** of payment solutions with POS systems, PSPs, and internal platforms – both for modernization of legacy systems and adoption of new technologies.
* Plan and execute **User Acceptance Testing (UAT)**; maintain test environments and ensure system reliability, performance, and security.
* Perform root cause analysis and coordinate resolution of **payment-related incidents** together with vendors and internal teams.
* Ensure compliance with **PCI DSS, GDPR, and other regulatory frameworks**, maintaining a secure and compliant payment environment.
* Produce and maintain **technical documentation**, standards, and best practices for architecture, testing, and operations.
* Stay informed on emerging payment technologies, cloud integration patterns, and security practices, contributing to continuous improvement and innovation.
* Collaborate in an Agile environment, driving technical initiatives and supporting cross-functional delivery teams to maximize business value.

**WHO YOU ARE:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience in **technical coordination, project delivery, or system integration** within retail, fintech, or payment domains.
* Understanding **POS systems, PSP integrations, payment terminals, APIs, and transaction flows**.
* Experience with **UAT/test coordination, configuration management, and incident resolution.**
* Familiarity with **security and compliance frameworks** such as PCI DSS, GDPR.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate between technical and business perspectives.
* Analytical mindset with attention to detail, proactive problem-solving, and a passion for technology-driven business improvement.

  

**Additional Information** ***Please note***: As our culture and teamwork are very important to us, four days (80%) per week of in-office presence in our office are required.


This is a full-time position with a placement **in Stockholm**.

**WHO WE ARE**  

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here

**JOIN US**  

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.


Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Senior Nätverkskonsult
description:
Vi söker en Senior Nätverkskonsult som vill bli en del av oss på Telia Cygate!  

  



Mitt namn är Ragnar Bylehn och jag ansvarar för vår fantastiska konsultgruppering i Norrköping. Vi växer i Regionen och söker en kollega till vårt team som vill vara med på en resa tillsammans med våra kunder mot en digital infrastruktur.  



**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:**

Som Senior Nätverkskonsult får du arbeta högt som lågt med planering och design av olika nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar till installation, konfiguration och felsökning i våra riktigt stora kunders IT-miljöer. Våra kund- och leveransprojekt spänner ofta över flera tjänsteområden. Det innebär att du kommer få arbeta nära andra specialister inom våra tre fokusområden, nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT. Här kan du få djupare insikt och ny inspiration i allt från Cloud, Security och on-prem, och de senaste kombinationerna där emellan. Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom fler områden så stödjer vi det och vill att du ska utvecklas.


* **Planering och design** av nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar hos kund på olika nivåer
* **Installation, konfiguration och felsökning** i komplexa IT-miljöer hos stora kunder
* **Självständigt arbete** med mycket kundkontakt

**För att lyckas i rollen:**

Som person har du en förmåga att engagera kunder såväl som dina kollegor. Du kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får ge utlopp för tankar och idéer där du använder din verksamhetsförståelse för att omsätta krav till genomförbara lösningar. Du är lösningsorienterad, arbetar proaktivt och vill lyckas tillsammans med andra. Förutom det får du tillhöra en växande organisation som uppmuntrar dig på din egen utvecklingsresa.  

  



* **Tidigare erfarenhe** t inom nätverksteknik med fokus på switching och routing
* **Tidigare Erfarenhet** av att arbeta med installation, konfiguration, administration samt felsökning
* **Kunskap av att arbeta** med lösningar från Cisco och/eller Fortinet
* **Certifieringar** ses som starkt meriterande
* **Kunskap inom nätverkssäkerhet** ses som meriterande
* **Innehar** körkort B
* **Flytande svenska och engelska** , i tal och skrift

**Varför Telia Cygate?**

På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.  

  



Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.  

  



Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!


**Vad vi erbjuder**  

När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.  



**Låter det intressant? Ansök!**

Vi ser frame mot din ansökan senast **2025-12-07** . Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat - så vänta in för länge!  



Placeringsort: Norrköping


Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår Talent Acquisition Partner. Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.


Vill du veta mer om rollen? Kontakta gärna mig, Ragnar Bylehn på Ragnar.Bylehn@cygate.se


**Lika möjligheter för alla**

På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.  



**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Säkerhetskonsult
description:
Vi söker en Säkerhetskonsult som vill bli en del av oss på Telia Cygate!


Jag heter Dennis Bergman Karlsson och jag har förmånen att leda vårt Säkerhetsteam i Region mellan. Jag letar efter en ny kollega till rollen som Säkerhetskonsult som vill växa tillsammans med oss. Vi är ett stöttande och framtidsinriktat team som fokuserar på att ha roligt på jobbet och hjälpa våra kunder mot en digital infrastruktur.


**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:**  



Som Säkerhetskonsult hos oss kommer du att arbeta nära dina kollegor i olika typer av projekt ute hos kund. Du kommer arbeta med allt från implementationsprojekt där du får dyka djupt in i installation, design, migrering, konfiguration och felsökning av toppmoderna säkerhetslösningar, till att du tar dig an en mer rådgivande roll och guida kunderna rätt i säkerhetsdjungeln. Våra kunder litar på oss för att säkerställa deras IT-miljöer och vi hjälper dem inte bara att driva och underhålla, utan även att planera och framtidssäkra deras lösningar.  

  



Hos oss jobbar du inte i en bubbla. Våra projekt sträcker sig ofta över flera tjänsteområden, vilket innebär att du får samarbeta med våra experter inom nätverk, säkerhet och Hybrid IT. På så sätt får du både spets och bredkompetens, från nät- och säkerhetsdrift till Cloud, automation, virtualisering och datacenter. Och om du vill certifiera dig inom nya områden? Vi stöttar dig hela vägen!


**För att lyckas i rollen:**  

  

Vi letar efter dig som brinner för att lösa kunders tekniska utmaningar och älskar att stå inför både tekniker och beslutsfattare för att förklara våra lösningar på ett engagerande sätt. Vi ser att du gärna tar dig an en rådgivande roll och drivs av att hjälpa kunderna hitta rätt lösningar för deras behov. Du har gedigen erfarenhet av säkerhetslösningar med fokus på en eller flera produkter.


* **Tidigare arbetat** med lösningar från Checkpoint, Fortinet, Infoblox och F5.
* **Gedigen erfarenhet** inom IT-säkerhet och nätverk, med fokus på brandväggar, DNS/DHCP och lastbalansering. Djup teknisk förståelse för nätverksprotokoll och infrastrukturtjänster
* **Van att arbeta** i komplexa miljöer med höga krav på säkerhet, tillgänglighet och prestanda
* **Erfarenhet av** design, implementation och felsökning av säkerhetslösningar i både on-prem och hybridmolnsmiljöer.
* **Svenska och engelska** , i tal och skrift

**Varför Telia Cygate?**  

  

På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.  

  



Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.  

  



Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!
  

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**  

  

När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.


**Låter det intressant?**  



Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast **2025-12-07.**

Placeringsort: Norrköping
  

  

Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår Talent Acquisition Partner. Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.  

  



Vill du veta med om rollen? Kontakta gärna Dennis Bergman Karlsson på dennis.karlsson@cygate.se

På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. title: Senior Nätverkskonsult
description:
Vi söker en Senior Nätverkskonsult som vill bli en del av oss på Telia Cygate!  

  



Mitt namn är Ragnar Bylehn och jag ansvarar för vår fantastiska konsultgruppering i Växjö. Vi växer i Regionen och söker en kollega till vårt team som vill vara med på en resa tillsammans med våra kunder mot en digital infrastruktur.  



**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:**

Som Senior Nätverkskonsult får du arbeta högt som lågt med planering och design av olika nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar till installation, konfiguration och felsökning i våra riktigt stora kunders IT-miljöer. Våra kund- och leveransprojekt spänner ofta över flera tjänsteområden. Det innebär att du kommer få arbeta nära andra specialister inom våra tre fokusområden, nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT. Här kan du få djupare insikt och ny inspiration i allt från Cloud, Security och on-prem, och de senaste kombinationerna där emellan. Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom fler områden så stödjer vi det och vill att du ska utvecklas.


* **Planering och design** av nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar hos kund på olika nivåer
* **Installation, konfiguration och felsökning** i komplexa IT-miljöer hos stora kunder
* **Självständigt arbete** med mycket kundkontakt

**För att lyckas i rollen:**

Som person har du en förmåga att engagera kunder såväl som dina kollegor. Du kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får ge utlopp för tankar och idéer där du använder din verksamhetsförståelse för att omsätta krav till genomförbara lösningar. Du är lösningsorienterad, arbetar proaktivt och vill lyckas tillsammans med andra. Förutom det får du tillhöra en växande organisation som uppmuntrar dig på din egen utvecklingsresa.  

  



* **Tidigare erfarenhe** t inom nätverksteknik med fokus på switching och routing
* **Tidigare Erfarenhet** av att arbeta med installation, konfiguration, administration samt felsökning
* **Kunskap av att arbeta** med lösningar från Cisco och/eller Fortinet
* **Certifieringar** ses som starkt meriterande
* **Kunskap inom nätverkssäkerhet** ses som meriterande
* **Innehar** körkort B
* **Flytande svenska och engelska** , i tal och skrift

**Varför Telia Cygate?**

På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. title: New Logo Account Executive
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**  

The New Logo Account Executive is a pivotal role to ensuring ServiceNow’s continued growth. In this role, you will identify new business by strategically navigating a targeted set of prospective accounts to close initial opportunities and convert our Prospects to Customers who will grow with us for years to come. By deeply understanding their unique company challenges and goals, you will pair them with solutions that will help them reach their business objectives and blaze new trails within their organizations. You play a critical part in our “DESCO21” go-to-market strategy, and you will be set up for success within a fast paced, collaborative, and inclusive culture.


You are a self-starter and an innovator. You will establish relationships within a defined set of accounts to achieve net new revenue growth targets for your given territory. By leveraging analytics, case studies, past performance, and market intelligence, you will create a territory plan and craft your own target account strategies. You will then apply these strategies and leverage your extended sales team and partner ecosystem to sell the value and long-term ROI of one or more of our industry leading solutions.


Post-sale you will lead in orchestrating the transition of these accounts to our established Account Management team as you continue to focus on net new logo accounts.

**What you get to do in this role:**

* Strategic territory planning - Follow a disciplined and analytical approach to planning and maintaining a target new account pipeline. Keep pipeline current and progressing.
* Sales strategies - Develop effective and specific account plans to maximize new revenue growth. Develop and leverage relationships throughout our strong partner networks and in your net new customer accounts to drive strategy through organization.
* Creative marketing and prospecting – Think outside-the-box to cultivate awareness of the ServiceNow vision. Strong planning and execution of targeted campaigns for your territory.
* Customer Acumen - Actively understand each customer’s strategic growth plans, technology footprint and corresponding technology strategy, internal challenges and competitive landscape. Review public information (e.g., new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the prospect.
* Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap.
* Account Transition – After successfully closing your initial sale, you will orchestrate the transition of the account to our Account Management team.
* Net New Revenue – Execute on new business revenue goals for the organization.

 **Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* Proven track record of new logo sales experience in IT Service Management, HR, Security Operations, Customer Service, IT Operations Management (within software or IT sales organizations) and/or Management Consulting, with a demonstrated ability to generate new business at new accounts.
* Demonstrated experience in territory strategy, planning and sales execution with measurable wins.
* Ability to understand broad, macro-level business IT needs for a prospective client.
* Ability to break down a complex sales process into discrete activities and see steps ahead to deliver customer outcomes.
* Excellent interpersonal skills to inspire and lead a matrix team to establish trust and credibility with prospective customers.
* Demonstrated perseverance, resilience, and savvy to find new creative paths to open doors, increase interaction and participation, and engage prospects.
* The ideal candidate lives our values to “stay hungry and humble” and doesn’t take their success for granted, always curious, ready to learn and evolve.
* Travel up to 50% (depending on geography/region)
* Fluency in Swedish and English

**Preferred Qualifications**

* 7+ years of quota carrying, technology solution-based direct sales experience, penetrating net new accounts within a territory.
* Strong sales strategy skills and demonstrated experience prospecting and bringing in new business.
* Experience and success selling a variety of SaaS solutions across all lines of business.
* Demonstrated experience in keeping accurate forecast your territory, monthly/quarterly/annually, utilizing sales tools and analytics to target customers with higher propensity to buy and creating strategies that maximize success.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Track record of consistently achieving or surpassing your sales quota

  

**Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.


From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.
company_description: At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible.

title: Senior Regional Sales Director, Nordics
description:
**Build Your Career at Informatica**
------------------------------------


We're looking for a diverse group of collaborators who believe data has the power to improve society. Adventurous, work-from-anywhere minds who value solving some of the world's most challenging problems. Here, employees are encouraged to push their boldest ideas forward, united by a passion to create a world where data improves the quality of life for people and businesses everywhere.


The Regional Sales Director leads a team of Account Managers who sell our full suite of products including licenses, support, training, and consulting services for the Nordics region. You will use your and our experience with structured sales techniques that span the entire sales cycle: From identification and qualification of opportunities; to business development; and order fulfilment, helping your team over-achieve their sales goals.


**Our Ideal Candidate**


We are seeking an experienced Regional Sales Director to develop our Accounts across the Nordic region. You will report to the GVP of UK&I Sales Leader. This will include managing and growing a team of 6+ Accounts Sales Executives. You will generate growth within new and existing customers and have a track record in hyper-growth sales teams. You will manage a team to a bold target with expectations to overachieve.


The ideal candidate will have experience managing Software Sales teams that are selling complex Integration, Cloud, Big Data, Data Governance and/or SaaS into corporate companies.


**Your Responsibilities**


You will develop and execute a strategic and comprehensive business plan for your region. Your focus is to build positive relationships with your direct reports and to develop them to surpass their sales goals. You will take full responsibility for accurate forecasting and quarterly revenue delivery. A significant portion of your will be invested with your team in the field visiting existing customers, and building relations with potential accounts, whilst aligning with strategic partners.


Other responsibilities include the following:


* Be an Informatica ambassador within accounts, maximizing our brand recognition and mindshare at all levels, evangelizing our solution and publicizing success stories
* As a Regional Sales Director you will be expected to exceed territory growth, revenue quota, and customer satisfaction goals
* Hire and build out the team
* Lead a customer-focused team of Strategic Accounts Sales Executives to deliver customer business value and develop customer relationships
* Build awareness for Informatica in target accounts across the Region
* Collaborate with other departments to develop an impactful sales strategy for enhancing the company's growth
* Create value selling in multiple negotiations
* Assist in pricing strategy
* Ensure prospecting, up selling/cross selling, and pipeline development
* Maintain implementation of effective sales processes for optimum performance and success of the organization
* Keep a pulse on the market: Know the landscapes and trends that may shift tactical budgets and strategic directions of accounts
* Build relationships with our partners

**Qualifications**


* 10+ years of successful enterprise software sales/sales management with personal experience closing high value software deals and a history of exceeding targets
* Knowledge of how software is positioned and sold to line of business, IT and procurement executives
* Previous Sales Methodology training
* Experience building organisations and hiring and training top talent
* Track record of over-achieving quota in past opportunities
* Negotiate mutually agreeable outcomes with customers and internal stakeholders
* University degree or equivalent practical experience

**Perks & Benefits**
--------------------


* Comprehensive health, vision, and wellness benefits (Paid parental leave, adoption benefits, life insurance, disability insurance and 401k plan or international pension/retirement plans
* Flexible time-off policy and hybrid working practices
* Tuition reimbursement program to support your and personal growth
* Equity opportunities and an employee stock purchase program (ESPP)
* Comprehensive Mental Health and Employee Assistance Program (EAP) benefit

We're guided by our DATA values and we are passionate about building and delivering solutions that accelerate data innovations. At Informatica, we know diversity drives innovation. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to maintaining a work environment free from discrimination, one where all employees are treated with dignity.


Informatica (NYSE: INFA), an Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader, brings data and AI to life by empowering businesses to realize the transformative power of their most critical assets. We pioneered the Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud™ that manages data across any multi-cloud, hybrid system, democratizing data to advance business strategies. Customers in over 100 countries and 85 of the Fortune 100 rely on Informatica. www.informatica.com. Connect with LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook. Informatica. **Where data and AI come to life.**
company_description: Informatica, the Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader, empowers businesses to realize the transformative power of data.

title: Business Development Manager - EMEA
description:
Business Development Manager - EMEA

  

**Date:** Nov 19, 2025


**Location:** Sweden - Stockholm


**Company:** Super Micro Computer


**Job Req ID: 27999**
**About Supermicro:**

Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.**Job Summary:**

Supermicro is seeking an experienced Business Development Manager to join our EMEA team. This role is focused on winning new enterprise customers and expanding our footprint within existing accounts. You will drive revenue growth by promoting Supermicro’s broad solutions portfolio, building multi-level executive relationships, and orchestrating cross-functional alignment to close high-value opportunities. The ideal candidate brings a proven track record in business development, a customer-first mindset, and the ability to translate strategy into measurable results across the EMEA region.**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Identify, win and expand enterprise customer accounts across AI training/inference, HPC, data platforms, cloud, IoT and edge.
* Build multi-threaded relationships and executive sponsorship in large complex customers.
* Drive joint pursuits with key industry alliances and technology partners.
* Maintain and grow relationships with existing customers by identifying cross-sell/upsell paths to increase share of wallet.
* Research trends and market signals to open new sales areas and craft vertical plays (Finance, Public Sector, Telco/Media, Manufacturing, Retail, Energy).
* Operate with discipline: keep pipeline accurate and current, progress deals with clear next actions, and forecast credibly.

Collaborate cross-functionally with commercial, technical and operations teams to ensure customer experience excellence.  
* 
  

**Qualifications:**
* 5-10+ years in enterprise business development / strategic sales for infrastructure (servers, storage, AI/HPC, cloud/edge) with a record of new-logo wins and design-in selling.
* Proven ability to originate pipeline and manage complex, multi-stakeholder pursuits (IT, LoB, procurement, partners).
* Proven track record of driving enterprise business development and sales across the EMEA region.
* Ability to translate technical concepts into vertical-aligned value propositions, linking workload/architecture decisions to measurable outcomes in executive discussions.
* Strong process rigour with excellent pipeline hygiene, crisp written/oral communications and executive presence.
**EEO Statement**

Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
**Education changes lives. But tech hasn’t lived up to its promise—yet. At Kognity, we’re here to change that.**


We’re a 125-person EdTech scale-up powering learning in 120+ countries. Our intelligent platform combines rich pedagogy with smart AI to help students and teachers thrive — from international schools to US high schools.

**Why Kognity is the place to be:**

* Educational Innovation – Lead the next wave of AI-powered learning solutions
* Global Reach – Our platform is used in 120+ countries across international and US markets
* Collaborative Culture – Join a smart, ambitious team that values impact over ego
* Ownership – You’ll shape the product vision, structure the org, and drive our AI-first transformation
* High-Performing Teams – Work with sharp, driven colleagues across product, engineering, and AI who raise the bar every day.

**What you’ll do:**

* Design, implement, and maintain scalable data models and transformations to deliver clean, reliable business-ready datasets.
* Collaborate with data engineers to integrate new data sources, automate workflows, and ensure reliable, high-performing data pipelines.
* Develop and maintain a semantic layer to standardize key metrics and definitions across the organization.
* Implement data quality checks, testing frameworks, and governance practices to ensure accuracy and consistency.
* Partner with stakeholders across teams to translate business needs into robust analytical and modeling solutions.
* Continuously improve tools, processes, and architecture while staying up to date with modern analytics engineering best practices.

**What we’re looking for:**

* Experience in analytics or data engineering with modern cloud data stacks (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift).
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical details to non-technical audiences.
* Strong SQL and dbt experience, with proven skills in building and maintaining dimensional data models.
* Experience with ELT/ETL workflows, version control (Git), and data governance.
* Detail-oriented, self-driven, and collaborative, with a knack for spotting inefficiencies and improving processes.
* A curiosity for AI and a drive to experiment with new tools to enhance creativity, decisions, and execution.

**Our Interview process**


Our hiring process is all about you. Show us your skills, tackle real-world challenges, and get a real feel for life at Kognity. Expect case studies, honest conversations, and plenty of chances to shine.

* Discovery Call with a Recruiter: A friendly chat with a Recruiter to explore if the role is likely to be a good mutual fit.
* Hiring Manager Hangout: Deep dive into the role and share your experience.
* Case study: Work on solving a real-world problem.
* Values Interview: Share your experiences and ways of thinking in relation to our values.
* Leadership discussion: Connect with one of our leaders to talk about big ideas, bold vision, and where you could grow with us.

**Our Values**

* We take ownership – We take initiative and act with self-leadership. We don’t wait for someone else to solve problems we see.
* We leverage AI – We apply AI to enhance creativity, decisions, and execution to allow for impact maximization.
* We drive customer value – Success for our customers drives our progress. We create value for them in everything we do.
* We are transparent – We are radically transparent with opinions and feedback, and we share information widely.
* We take care of ourselves and each other – We work hard and passionately, but also prioritise our own well-being, and that of our colleagues.

**Benefits**

* Truly Hybrid — work from our Stockholm office when you like.
* ITP Pension Plan with Nordnet.
* Yearly budget of 5,000 SEK to spend on health-related services.
* 30 days of paid vacation every year.
* Full pay sick leave starting on day 1.


Every qualified person will be evaluated regardless of age, gender, identity, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive team and welcome people of all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.


See more about how we collect and process your personal data in our Privacy Notice.
company_description: Kognity is one the fastest growing EdTech companies in the world and we aim to radically improve learning for 1.5 billion school students globally.

title: Solution Owner - D365 Customer Insights Journeys & Data
description:
At Husqvarna Group, we are not only building innovative outdoor power tools — we are also transforming into a data-driven, digitally empowered company. Our IT and data landscape spans continents, cloud platforms, and diverse business areas, and we are on a mission to turn data into a true asset at every level of the organization.
With a legacy of innovation dating back to 1689 — from sewing machines and motorcycles to chainsaws and robotic lawnmowers — Husqvarna has always evolved with the times. Today, that evolution is digital, and the future is powered by data.
As part of this journey, CRM and Customer Insights are key focus areas in our strategy, driving our ambition to put the customer at the very center of everything we do. Now, we are looking for a Solution Owner - D365 Customer Insights Journeys & Data who can help us take our data platform to the next level and ensure that customer insights truly guide our business forward.
About this role
As Solution Owner for Dynamics 365 Customer Insights Journeys and Data, you will be at the heart of Husqvarna Group’s customer-focused transformation. Our ambition is clear: to understand our customers better, act on insights faster, and make every interaction more meaningful. That journey depends on a solid, future-ready CRM and Customer Insights platform — combining journey orchestration in CRM with a powerful Customer Data Platform (CDP).
You will join the CRM/CI Delivery team within GIS (Global Information Services), taking full ownership of the Customer Insights platform. It will be your responsibility to ensure that the system is not only reliable in its daily operations but also continuously developed to match our strategic roadmaps and Microsoft’s product evolution. Working closely with several Business Product Owners, Super Users, and Microsoft’s product team, you will act as the link between business vision and technical delivery — turning strategy into action and data into real business value.
In practice, this means that you will:* Lead and continuously improve Dynamics 365 Customer Insights Journeys (CI-J) and Customer Insights Data (CI-D), setting and following up on clear KPIs. The CI-D platform is built on a complex Azure infrastructure, which together with CI-J provides the CDP capability — not only to the CRM solution today, but in the future also to other Husqvarna systems and applications.
* Guide the technical solution team for CI-J and CI-D, ensuring strong delivery in both operations and development.
* Safeguard compliance and proactively strengthen data protection, security, and consent management processes.
* Secure high-quality customer data from multiple sources (Salesforce, SAP, Snowflake, etc.) to make the CDP a trusted foundation for insights.
* Enable marketing automation and customer engagement through smarter segmentation, activation, and communication.
* Drive automation within operations and explore how AI capabilities can be introduced into the solution over time.

About you
You’re someone who enjoys working at the intersection of data, technology, and customer experience. With a solid background in Dynamics 365, you know how to turn data into insights that actually make a difference. You’re used to moving between different platforms and systems, and you feel confident making them work together in a way that brings value — whether in a B2C or B2B setting. Just as importantly, you like working with others: bringing structure to complex projects, keeping things moving forward, and making sure collaboration leads to results.
We believe you have a customer-centric mindset, naturally turning insights into real outcomes for both users and the business. You’re a clear communicator who can make complex data and technology topics easy to understand and act upon for non-technical stakeholders. You enjoy solving problems — testing, iterating, and making smart trade-offs when challenges arise. And finally, you bring a positive, adaptive attitude, thriving in a changing environment with evolving roadmaps and Microsoft releases.
What you bring* Solid hands-on knowledge of Dynamics 365 Customer Insights – Journeys and Data, including segmentation, consent management, and real-time triggers.
* Experience connecting different systems and platforms (e.g. Databricks, Snowflake, Salesforce, SAP, Azure, Dynamics 365 & Power Platform, Power Automate, Logic Apps).
* Strong skills in analyzing and organizing large data sets, and turning them into clear actions and insights. (While this is currently supported by a Data Engineer or Analyst within the team, it is still considered a valuable skill to have.)
* Background in working with CDP data across both consumer and business markets.
* Confidence in navigating cross-functional teams and complex project environments, with a focus on getting things done.

Location
This position will be placed in one of our main sites in Sweden (Huskvarna, Stockholm, or Jonsered). With our hybrid working environment, you'll have the flexibility to work both onsite and remotely, promoting work-life balance for all team members. We meet in the office at least 2–3 days a week (50%).
Your Application
We look forward to your application — please note that we will make an ongoing selection.
For questions regarding the process, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner, Kristin Sundlo, kristin.sundlo@husqvarnagroup.com
Last date to apply:
10 December 2025

title: Senior Business Analyst M3 Development Team
description:
Join Infor’s M3 Development Team as a Senior Business Analyst and help shape the future of our cloud-based ERP platform. Based in Linköping or Stockholm, you’ll work on core architectural components and common functionality used across industries like Food & Beverage, Fashion, Distribution, and Equipment. This role blends deep technical insight with business acumen, offering a unique opportunity to influence product direction and deliver scalable solutions to global customers.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
Translate business requirements into detailed solution designs and functional specifications
  
Collaborate with developers to ensure accurate and efficient implementation of features
  
Participate in debugging and technical discussions with a working understanding of Java code
  
Lead requirement analysis, design, verification, and documentation for new features and customer-reported issues
  
Perform testing and validation of new functionalities, including test automation
  
Prepare user documentation and conduct demos to support feature adoption
  
Contribute to architectural components such as printouts, archiving, and job management
  
Engage with requirement owners and application leads to aligning priorities and solutions
  
Support cross-functional teams and foster a collaborative, team-oriented work environment
  
  

Required Qualifications
  
Proven experience as a Business Analyst in a technical or software development environment
  
Strong understanding of solution design and system architecture
  
Ability to read and understand Java code
  
Experience working with ERP systems or enterprise software products
  
Excellent communication, documentation, and analytical skills
  
Comfortable working in cross-functional and geographically distributed teams
  
Fluent in English
  
  

Preferred Qualifications
  
Background in software development or a transition from development to business analysis
  
Experience with Infor M3 or similar ERP systems
  
University degree in Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, or related field
  
Experience leading teams or initiatives
  
Swedish language skills (a plus, but not mandatory)
company_description: Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry-specific markets.

title: English and Spanish speaking Account Manager to Linköping
description:
About this position
  
TaxiCaller is looking to expand our sales them with an Account Mangager who will primarily work with our leads and customers in North America.
  
TaxiCaller has a strong inbound strategy, and you will mostly work with assigned qualified leads, but you will also work with outbound sales, e.g. cold calling.
  
A lead is a taxi company (or other kinds of transportation companies) who is looking to upgrade their dispatch system.
  
You will work with the full sales cycle from first demo to a closed deal. After the deal is closed you as an account manager will work together with our excellent support team to make sure we keep our great customer retention.
  
The sales will mainly be done via web meetings and phone, so travelling will not be required for this position.
  
It is a very developing job in an international environment where you will interact with a lot of people every day.
  
  

About you
  
We are looking for a person who has excellent skills in closing sales.
  
* You should have a proven track record with a couple of years’ experience in B2B sales.
* Good track record in cold calling and outbound sales.
* You need to be fluent in English and Spanish with no accent.
* You need to have a good drive and be able to work independently.
* You have good analytical skills and you are pedagogical.


You don't have to be able to speak Swedish, since TaxiCaller is a true international company with colleagues and customers from all over the world.
  
  

**We see it as positive if:**  

* You also speak a third language, e.g. French.
* You have previous experience in working with international SaaS sales.


About TaxiCaller
  
TaxiCaller was founded in 2011 and has developed a cloud-based taxi dispatch system with support for iPhone and Android apps which quickly reached international success and is currently used by taxi companies throughout the world. TaxiCaller's dispatch system is groundbreaking because we use the latest technology in both web solutions and smartphones. We are experiencing strong demand for our product and because of that we need to strengthen our sales department.

title: 1st Line Support Agent (English and Spanish speaking)
description:
The company has developed a groundbreaking cloud service for transportation companies. They have customers all over the world.
  
They are experiencing strong demand of their product and because of that they need to strengthen their 1st line support team with a Spanish and English speaking support agent.
  
This position is in Linköping and you need to work from the office.
  
  

About you
  
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think “outside the box”.
* You possess great computing skills and are interested in all things technical.
* You provide a high level of customer service and have a full understanding of its importance.
* You are a curious and fast learner.
* You communicate clearly in English and Spanish, both verbally and in writing.


This is considered an entry-level position and although we don’t believe that you need specific qualifications to succeed in this role, it is very important that you are interested in tech, and have a basic understanding of computing, cloud-based services, and mobile technology.
  
  

About the position
  
As a 1st line support agent, no two days will look the same.
  
Your daily focus will be to help our customers through phone, web chat and email.
  
You will help our customers solving their problems and making sure they have the correct settings on their account.
  
Over time, you will become an expert in the system and point of contact for anyone internally, you’ll be providing operational and technical support to teams across all of our departments.
  
The working hours will be normal office hours, Monday to Friday.
  
  

Your daily tasks will include
  
* Help the customers through phone, web chat and email, to make sure the customers can use the system the way they want it to work.
* Supporting the sales teams in sales demos and general technical support.


It will be considered an advantage if
  
* You speak additional languages, especially Swedish, Finnish, or French.
* You have experience in technical support, ideally in an international environment.


For this position you need to already have a Swedish work permit.

title: Service Support Engineer - PIM (Inriver & Azure)
description:
We are now looking for a **Service Support Engineer - Product Information Management within Inriver & Azure,** for a global manufacturing company in **Lund.**

 **Start is ASAP, 1 year's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

  

* **Key Responsibilities:****1. Application Support & Maintenance**


	+ Provide L2/L3 support for the Inriver PIM platform, ensuring system stability and performance.
	+ Handle incident resolution, root cause analysis, and problem management.
	+ Coordinate with vendor (Inriver) and internal development teams for escalations.

 **2. Data Operations & Monitoring**

* + Manage and monitor data synchronization between Inriver, Azure, and downstream systems.
	+ Handle troubleshooting of data pipelines, APIs, and connectors.
	+ Perform routine health checks, validations, and batch job monitoring.**3. Azure Data Management**


	+ Work with Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, and related services for data ingestion and transformation.
	+ Develop or maintain scripts and automation tools for recurring operational tasks.**4. Change & Release Management**


	+ Support deployment activities, configuration changes, and release testing.
	+ Maintain up-to-date technical and operational documentation.**5. Continuous Improvement**


	+ Identify system inefficiencies and propose optimizations.
	+ Contribute to knowledge base articles and team process enhancements.**Required Skills & Experience:**


	+ 3–5 years of experience in application or system support roles, preferably in product data management environments.
	+ Strong knowledge of Inriver PIM, including data model configuration, workflows, and inte-grations.
	+ Hands-on experience with Azure cloud services, especially Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Functions.
	+ Solid understanding of API integrations, RESTful services, and data exchange mechanisms.
	+ Experience with incident, change, and release management tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira).
	+ Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate technical issues clear-ly.**Preferred / Nice-to-Have Skills:**


	+ Experience in data modeling, ETL processes, or product master data management.
	+ Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for cloud-based systems.
	+ Exposure to Power BI or similar tools for monitoring and analytics.
	+ Basic scripting knowledge (PowerShell, Python, or SQL).
	+ Scrum Master/Jira/Confluence**Educational Background:**


	+ Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical discipline.
	+ Inriver or Microsoft Azure certifications will be a plus.**Soft Skills:**


	+ Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
	+ Proactive, service-oriented mindset.
	+ Ability to manage multiple issues and priorities simultaneously.
	+ Clear written and verbal communication.

This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in **Lund**. Start is ASAP, **1 year's contract** to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Technology Strategy Consultant
description:
*Join* *Accenture* *Technology Strategy team* *at our**Stockholm**office* *and* *advise* *our clients through their digital transformation journeys.*


Every day we are developing business and technology leaders, bringing together innovation, business development and technology leadership under one umbrella. We offer you the opportunity to join and shape our journey as we work with some of the largest and most innovative companies in the world. In this role you will provide expertise and insights for Accenture clients through value-driven recommendations in the intersection between business and technology strategy.

**About Accenture** Technology Strategy & Advisory practice:


We at Strategy Technology & Advisory help our clients become industry leaders. With our cross-expertise in technology, strategy, and consulting, we work closely with our clients to find their focus areas in the market and identify organizational and technological building blocks to reach the target state. We are helping our clients to create sustainable and digital change for the future to identify value across financial, experience, sustainability, talent, and inclusion & diversity dimensions.


Below are examples with areas you could work with:

* Advise clients on how to develop their business by leveraging emerging and established technologies
* Create intelligent operating models to transform and build organizations ready for growth and stability
* Unlock the value of data, architecture, and AI to drive business agility and transformation to a real-time enterprise
* Identify, quantify, maximize, and sustain value realization from technology investments
* … and much more!

We pride ourselves in building long-lasting relationships with our clients by driving powerful outcomes and inspiring with impact. We act as trusted advisors at the largest and most well-known companies in the Nordics and Globally. We are building a community with the best people based on our Secret Sauce; we believe that transparency and openness, the ability to make impact and make yourself heard, together with a great team feeling and a sense of belonging are our keys to success.


  

**Who we are looking for:**

  

  

We are looking for curious people willing to question the current ways of working by utilizing new technologies, agile ways of working and new business models to bring new ideas and innovations to life. With us you will have the opportunity to work with large scale business transformations enabled by digital and be a key advisor for c-suites in leading Nordic companies. We hope you are someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and can make everyone take advantage of their various strengths.

* 3+ years of experience from consulting and/or working with IT strategy, operating models, data & analytics, future tech, cloud strategy, tech transformation etc.
* Ability to identify and pursue new business opportunities
* Put ideas and findings into the right context for the right audience, both written and verbally in English and preferably in Swedish
* An analytical and structural mindset, who can achieve impressive results and thrive in settings where you define, structure, and solve clients pain points
* In addition to delivering projects, we are looking for experiences in team-leading and driving internal activities (e.g. recruiting, social, training, etc.).
* Master's degree in a relevant field with excellent academic results
* Fluent in English
* Flexibility in terms of travel and work across the Nordics is expected
**What we can offer you:**

* Competitive benefit package: truly competitive salary terms, bonus schemes, pension, health insurance, employee stock purchase program and other benefits.
* Market-leading expertise and great learning opportunities: we use our global network of experts to stay up to date on technology and industry trends to be relevant in client dialogue - and we are never fully trained.
* Work in a team dedicated to complex problem solving: utilize the sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, which provide an unbeatable platform from which to advance your career.
* Fun at work and work-life balance - we make good arrangements to combine family life (and leisure time in general) with work life.
 **Are you excited** **by** **the opportunity?** Apply now and attach your CV and Cover Letter in English. We look forward to receiving your application!

  

  

Be sure to follow us on Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn.


Do you have questions about the role?


Feel free to reach out to hedvig.orvenholt@accenture.com (Tech Strategy Consultant) or magnus.wigern.s@accenture.com (HR/Recruiting)

  

  

To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired, please visit our website: Accenture | Sweden | Let there be change

title: Information Security & Compliance Manager
description:
### **Your new role**


We are looking for an Information Security & Compliance Manager to join our client’s team in Sweden. In this role, you will take a leading position in shaping and implementing security strategies across IT and development projects. You will manage complex initiatives, provide guidance to junior professionals, and ensure secure practices across the organization. Your responsibilities include advising on security solutions, supporting cyber security initiatives, coordinating pilot projects, and engaging with stakeholders to deliver secure, high-quality IT solutions.

### **Company presentation**

Our client is a global technology organization known for innovation, research and development, and delivering secure, high-performing solutions. The team works in an agile and collaborative environment, offering opportunities to develop professionally and expand your expertise in cutting-edge security and compliance practices.

### **Good to know**

* Scope of employment: Full-time, 100%
* Type of contract: Fixed-term employment as a consultant via JobBusters
* Working model: Hybrid; minimum 2 days per week in office (Ludvika or Västerås), remote work possible for remaining days
* Salary: According to agreement
* Start date: 2026-01-15
* End date: 2027-01-14, with possibility of extension
* Application deadline: 2025-11-28


In your application: Please ensure your CV clearly demonstrates how you meet the required qualifications.

### **To succeed in this role, you will need:**

* 5–8 years of experience in IT security, compliance, or related fields, including leadership/management, with a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or equivalent experience)


* Strong expertise in information security, cyber security, secure coding, and life cycle management

  

* Experience in IT control systems, network, and cloud projects

  

* Ability to work independently on complex challenges and guide others

  

* Team-oriented mindset with knowledge of Agile methodologies

  

* Excellent communication skills in English

  


### **What we offer**

* Secure employment with a collective bargaining agreement, insurance coverage and occupational pension
* Wellness allowance and employee discounts and offers via Benifex (e.g., health, leisure, transport and healthcare)
* Flex pension and access to the Lifeplan pension advisory service
* Additional compensation during parental leave
* Occupational health services
* Long-term assignments and a dedicated Consultant Manager for personal support
* Opportunities to build valuable experience, expand your network and grow your future career

### **We look forward to receiving your application**


We review applications on an ongoing basis. As recruitment processes in the consulting industry can move quickly, the position may be filled before the advertised deadline — so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.


You do not need to submit a cover letter. Instead, please respond to the screening questions included in the application process.

title: Grafisk Producent (Inhouse Marknad) - Intersport
description:
**Production Artist / Grafisk Producent till INTERSPORT**


Vi på INTERSPORT lever och andas sport – varje dag. Nu söker vi dig som vill bidra till att skapa visuellt stark och enhetlig kommunikation och stärka ett av Sveriges mest välkända sportvarumärken.

**Om rollen**


Som **Production Artist / Grafisk Producent** är du länken mellan idé och färdigt material. Du blir en central del av vårt inhouse-marknadsteam och säkerställer att allt visuellt material håller hög kvalitet – oavsett om det ska tryckas, publiceras digitalt eller rörligt.


Du ser till att varje detalj stämmer: färger, format, tryckfiler och digitala anpassningar – allt för att våra kampanjer ska kännas enhetliga och inspirerande i alla kanaler.

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**

* Producera och anpassa grafiskt material till både tryck och digitala kanaler.
* Säkerställa att designen följer INTERSPORTs grafiska profil och håller hög teknisk och visuell kvalitet.
* Hantera originalproduktion för kampanjer, butiksmaterial, annonser, nyhetsbrev och sociala medier.
* Arbeta i nära samarbete med teamet på marknadsavdelningen för att utveckla kampanjer och visuella koncept.
* Bidra med kreativitet, struktur och leveransprecision i en dynamisk miljö.

**Vi tror att du har**

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom grafisk produktion, design eller motsvarande (t.ex. Yrgo, Medieinstitutet eller Berghs).
* **Erfarenhet av grafisk produktion**, som grafisk producent, AD-assistent/final art eller originalare - från reklambyrå eller marknadsavdelning.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i **Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)**.
* Erfarenhet av **digitala format** och **tryckproduktion**.
* Goda kunskap inom **rörligt material och videoproduktion (After Effects, Premiere Pro)**.
* Arbetat med **E-postverktyg**, där erfarenhet av Voyado är meriterande.
* Kunskap i verktyg för **dynamiska annonsformat (DCO)** är meriterande.

**För att lyckas hos oss behöver du**


Du är **kreativ** med **god formkänsla** och ett sinne för konsekvent varumärkesuttryck.


Du är **servicefokuserad och inkluderande** – och du brinner för att skapa tydlig, inspirerande kommunikation som väcker känsla.

  

Du har ett öga för detaljer, är strukturerad och trivs i ett högt tempo där deadlines möts med precision.


Du gillar ny teknik, har en stark vilja att utvecklas och trivs med att jobba i team där man lyfter varandra.


Du driver ditt arbete framåt och tar egna initiativ när det behövs.

**Varför INTERSPORT?**


Vi är mitt i en spännande förändringsresa där vi vill bli **Sveriges mest inspirerande sportdestination**. Hos oss får du:

* Arbeta med ett starkt varumärke som når miljoner kunder varje år.
* Vara del av ett engagerat inhouse-marknadsteam där energi, nyfikenhet och samarbete är centralt.
* Påverka hur INTERSPORT syns i både butik och digitala kanaler – varje dag.
* En roll med stort inflytande och möjlighet att växa.

**Vilja – Våga – Vinna – Vi är INTERSPORT** är mer än ord. Det är vår kultur.

* **Är du redo att skapa kommunikation som inspirerar och driver resultat?**


Sök rollen som **Production Artist / Grafisk Producent** och bli en del av vår resa

**Låter det som du?**


Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi intervjuar löpande.

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

* Tjänsten är på heltid och tillsvidare (provanställning tillämpas).
* Placering: Servicekontoret i Mölndal.
* Start: Februari 2026 (eller enligt överenskommelse).

title: Head of  BOS Enterprise Architecture
description:
**About This Opportunity**
 Ericsson is looking for a Head of Enterprise Architecture within Service Line (SL) Business and Operations Systems (BOS) as a key leadership role part of BOS Delivery Excellence, responsible for leading enterprise architecture practice and End-to-End solution presales and delivery in MEMA.
   

  

 This role reports to the Head of SL BOS Delivery Excellence for MEMA and will be part of BOS Delivery Excellence Leadership team.
   

  

 What You Will Do:
   

  

* Lead BOS End-to-End portfolio presales and solution delivery, managing end-to-end Solution & Enterprise Architects, and cross portfolio practicians.
* Establish and lead enterprise architecture and design authority practices.
* Senior People Manager of own unit and a senior Leader across matrixed organization extending to solution line professionals in other CU BOS, BOS solution lines and SD/SDU units.
* Set Individual Performance and Development goals for members with regular check-ins.
* Responsible for team dimensioning; and Cost Center Responsible to deliver over-Absorption target and required Utilization/Billability.
* Accountable for the pre-sales and delivery of BOS solutions in the context of complex offerings and transformations including 3rd party products & solutions.
* Plan lead and industrialize initiatives to augment Ericsson BOS offerings to create higher fit to customer needs and improve competitiveness.
* Responsible for competence management and upskilling of their community to serve business needs.
* Responsible to review and align delivery models; and secure the skillsets required to fulfill the delivery.
* Drive a Knowledge Sharing and Asset building culture across their community.
* Instill a culture of add-on sales and customer value maximization.
* Drive the full onboarding of automation in collaboration with BOS automation champions and Product Management.
* Lead product and integrated solutions escalations related to project issues and portfolio roadmap issues in collaboration with Business Development & Portfolio.
* Single Point of Accountability/Escalation for End-to-End and multi-component OSS and BSS solutions and delivery readiness perspectives.


 What You Will Bring:
   

  

* 12+ years of experience in telecom industry with leadership track record in OSS & BSS transformations with focus on both pre-sales and program delivery.
* University degree in ICT/Engineering. A graduate degree such as an MBA is a plus.
* Strong People Manager track record leading Senior Team members and leading Leaders.
* Enterprise Architecture & Framework Mastery (TOGAF, TMForum: eTOM, ODA, OpenAI, SID, TAM)
* Advanced experience with
* Cloud-Native & Platform Architecture.
* Security, Privacy & Compliance Architecture. /
* AI and automation strategy
* Data Management & Analytics
* Integration & API Ecosystem
* Agile, DevOps & Continuous Delivery
* Expert level in overall BOS portfolio including full stack BSS and OSS with surrounding Domains.
* Experience in leading complex transformation engagements in BSS and OSS domain.
* Demonstrated experience leading cross-functional highly matrixed and globally distributed teams.
* Mandatory certifications: Principal Solution Architect GIAP certification.
* Strong consultative, presentation, and communication skills
* Proven track record to deliver results within a time sensitive and high-pressure environment.
* Highly proficient collaboration skills
* Solid ability to communicate effectively at executive levels.
* In-depth knowledge of running Organizational and Solution Level Governance.
* Fluent in English; additional languages are a plus.


 Ericsson South Africa recruits in line with its Employment Equity plan and will therefore give preference to suitably qualified candidates who are members of designated groups. Would you like to take a tour to “Life at Ericsson MEA”, visit short video Click Here
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
